snippet.title: Outreach Colony: Alpha (ambient music to study/work to)
snippet.description:
üéá This piece was made using a whole load of MIDI code and synth generators to make a musical scene that generated itself. This is NOT AI generation - it was made entirely by myself. üéá

Hear it on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/album/40PRJSCmfPrmvShMGuSghN?si=cgNTJ9cgT4qC0mbaMvEiFg
Buy it on iTunes: https://music.apple.com/gb/album/outreach-colony-phi/1746029421

üçª BUY US A BEER WITH PATREON!üçª
https://www.patreon.com/HopPoleStudios
Thanks to our Patrons who made this possible - your names are at the end of the video. You make a huge difference!


The accompanying video scene however was generated by ComfyUI and  KSampler - the focus of this piece in my opinion though is the audio and not the video.
If anyone knows a cool animator who'd like to make a video piece to go along with the audio instead of the generated picture, let me know.


üì± FOLLOW US HERE üì±
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/adamsteelproducer
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/adamsteelproducer
*All links are affiliate links*

snippet.description:
Discover how content leaders from Banking, Financial Services and Insurance companies rely on Adobe Experience Manager Guides, a cloud-native CCMS, to transform their global content strategy. Accelerate your content supply chain with AEM Guides and deliver accurate, consistent and risk-free regulatory content, policies, SOPs, knowledgebases and information portals to your consumers across the globe.

snippet.title: How to Create an Indispensable Resource versus a Standard Help System with Adobe RoboHelp
snippet.description:
Adobe RoboHelp comes with a variety of features that, when implemented properly, can bring it from a good tool to an indispensable resource for the end-user.

In this webinar we will cover:
1. Creating microcontent to enable users to find quick answers to their questions.

2. Implementing content filters to help users parse information most relevant to them

3. Utilizing drop downs, expanded text, image maps and glossary hot spot terms to enable an end user to have both high level and detailed content in one source.

4. Identifying common content where snippets can be implemented to eliminate redundancy, enhance sustainability and provide a higher level of accuracy.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

snippet.title: FrameMaker Essentials: Migrating technical content from Word to DITA (step-by-step guide)
snippet.description:
Converting Word content to DITA and structured FrameMaker offers significant advantages for content creators. DITA ensures content consistency, reuse, and scalability, making it ideal for complex documentation projects. Structured FrameMaker provides a robust authoring environment with built-in DITA support, allowing users to create, manage, and publish content efficiently. With structured content, teams can streamline workflows, reduce duplication, and simplify multi-channel publishing, delivering content to print, web, and mobile seamlessly. Unlike Word, DITA and FrameMaker enable metadata-driven organization and powerful topic-based authoring, improving searchability and localization. This conversion ultimately boosts productivity and enhances content quality for global audiences.

You will learn how to:
‚Ä¢ Evaluate your MS Word documents for conversion
‚Ä¢ Create and apply styles to aid in conversion
‚Ä¢ Remove MS Word artifacts that can hinder conversion
‚Ä¢ Use FrameMaker to process your documents into DITA content
‚Ä¢ Set parameters for chunking data into appropriately sized topics
‚Ä¢ Add and remove content from processed files to conform to DITA   standards
‚Ä¢ Validate your content against the DITA content model
‚Ä¢ Publish rich PDF content from your DITA files
‚Ä¢ Customize PDF formatting for your output
‚Ä¢ Publish mobile-ready HTML5 from your DITA files
‚Ä¢ Customize HTML5 formatting


At the conclusion of the session, you‚Äôll be able to:
‚Ä¢ Easily convert your legacy unstructured Word documents to DITA
‚Ä¢ Identify, correct, and manage your structured DITA content
‚Ä¢ Publish your ditamaps and topics to both PDF and to the mobile-friendly HTML5 format
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

snippet.title: RoboHelp Essentials ‚Äì Building the Foundation of a Superior Help System
snippet.description:
Learn how to establish the essential foundational elements of a help system to ensure that it reflects your brand and provides a consistent look and feel. This is especially important for large deployments, highly regulated content, and image-heavy detailed topics.

In this webinar we will cover:
1. Creating branded style sheets covering the most critical styles in     authoring (lists, tables, headings, links) as well as some unique styles that can elevate your topics

2. Establishing topic layouts with standardized content for a variety of topic types (procedures, desktop aids, policies, etc.) and at the same time become living "style guides" for your company's standards and conventions

3. Creating templates for Word, PDF, and Frameless layouts to promote the company's image and brand in various layouts.

--------------------

snippet.title: Adobe RoboHelp Essentials ‚Äì Part 4 ‚Äì Microcontent and Chatbot
snippet.description:
Adobe RoboHelp Essentials ‚Äì Part 4 ‚Äì Microcontent and Chatbot
Take advantage of AI and machine learning to create chatbots and frequently asked questions in RoboHelp

Customers have come to expect information at every point of contact with your content. This includes on-demand chat, frequently asked questions, and responses from voice-based systems like Alexa and Siri.

RoboHelp makes it easy to leverage your existing content for use with these systems, taking advantage of artificial intelligence to deliver answers to questions using systems like Google Dialogflow.

In this session we will showcase how to:
- Create intents, similar to questions asked by clients
- Create responses to the intents
- Convert specialized assets
- Deliver output of the chatbot content
- Link the content to a machine learning system

After this workshop, you will be able to:
- Easily repurpose existing content for use with chatbots
- Connect your content to servers that help interpret questions and properly deliver results with natural language responses
- Set up a chatbot icon on your website to call up the chatbot system

More about Adobe RoboHelp:
https://www.adobe.com/products/robohelp.html

About the expert
Through his company, Tech Comm Tools, Matt Sullivan helps technical communicators create, manage, and deliver content. Matt regularly lectures to groups and conferences across the country on mobile, web, and interactive topics.
He is the author of an entire series of FrameMaker reference and workbooks and runs online training courses at https://www.techcommtools.com.

--------------------

snippet.title: Adobe FrameMaker Essentials ‚Äì Part 12 ‚Äì Translation Management with XLIFF
snippet.description:
Managing content in a single language is already challenging, but supporting multiple languages and regions significantly amplifies the complexity. Adobe FrameMaker simplifies this process, saving you both time and money through its robust support for localization using the industry-standard XLIFF format. XLIFF streamlines the translation workflow and ensures consistency across different languages, making the process more efficient and less error-prone. Join Matt Sullivan, an Adobe Certified Expert and Trainer, as he demonstrates how FrameMaker can optimize your translation management process.

In this session, Matt will guide you through preparing DITA and unstructured files for XLIFF-based translation workflows, comparing the costs of XLIFF versus non-XLIFF translation, and exporting your content to XLIFF. You‚Äôll learn how vendors accept and process these files and how you can import the translated XLIFF-files back into Adobe FrameMaker for seamless publishing.

Additionally, the session will cover how to manage templates for translated content effectively, ensuring a smooth localization process.

Key Takeaways:
- Learn to prepare FrameMaker files for efficient XLIFF workflows.
- Understand the benefits of using XLIFF compared to non-XLIFF translation methods.
- Master the process of exporting XLIFF files and understand how vendors handle them.
- Discover how to import translations back into Adobe FrameMaker files for publishing.
- Successfully manage templates for translated content and import localized XLIFF files.

This webinar is ideal for content professionals looking to streamline their translation management process and ensure high-quality, efficient localization using Adobe FrameMaker. Enhance your global documentation strategy with expert insights and practical techniques.

--------------------

snippet.title: Adobe FrameMaker Essentials ‚Äì Part 11 ‚Äì Word to DITA
snippet.description:
Are you ready to transition from Microsoft Word to structured content with DITA using Adobe FrameMaker? Join Matt Sullivan, an Adobe Certified Expert and Trainer, as he guides you through the essentials of migrating Microsoft Word files to DITA XML with Adobe FrameMaker.

DITA, a widely-adopted standard by large organizations globally, is essential for effective content management, localization, and other advanced technologies.

In this session, you will learn how to utilize the ‚ÄúConvert Word to DITA‚Äù function in Adobe FrameMaker, enabling you to start editing immediately. Matt will demonstrate how to open and directly edit DITA and DITAMAP files in Adobe FrameMaker, and share valuable tips on converting specialized assets. By the end of this workshop, you will have a solid understanding of the structure of basic DITA file types including Topic, Concept, Reference, and Task. You will also learn how to prepare Word and FrameMaker formats for more accurate and complete DITA conversion, and gain access to the necessary tools to edit DITA format files efficiently.
 
Key Takeaways
 
- DITA Structure Insights: Understand the structure of basic DITA file types such as Topic, Concept, Reference, and Task.
- Essential Editing Tools: Access the tools needed to efficiently edit DITA format files.
- Preparation Techniques: Prepare Word and FrameMaker formats for more accurate and complete DITA conversion.
- Efficient DITA Conversion: Master the process of converting Microsoft Word files to DITA using Adobe FrameMaker.
- Specialized Asset Tips: Receive tips on converting specialized assets for a smoother transition to DITA.
- Direct Editing Capabilities: Learn to open and directly edit DITA and DITAMAP files within Adobe FrameMaker.

This webinar is designed for Microsoft Word users considering a move to structured content with DITA and Adobe FrameMaker, as well as current Adobe FrameMaker users looking to migrate Word DOCX files to DITA.

snippet.description:
2021 Kindle Storyteller award winner Rachel McLean is known for her best-selling Detective Zoe Finch and Dorset Crime series. In January 2022, McLean‚Äôs releasing her new book 5 Steps to Author Success, which chronicles her journey from sporadic sales to her current success.

On December 16, Rachel joined us to share her story, selecting appropriate genres, and how she integrates reader expectations into her writing to increase sales.

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Michaelbrent Collings
snippet.description:
Novelist and  screenwriter Michaelbrent Collings is one of the most successful indie horror authors in the US, as well as an international best-selling thriller, fantasy, science fiction, and mystery writer. His works have been nominated for Bram Stoker, Dragon, and RONE awards.
Collings is a frequent guest at comic cons and writing podcasts like Six Figure Authors, The Creative Penn, Writing Excuses, and more. 
On October 28, Collings shared with us how writing helped him gain a whole new sense of hope and how branding and event attendance can build your readership.

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Sarina Bowen
snippet.description: Sarina Bowen, formerly a Wall Street trader, is the award-winning author of over thirty contemporary- and LGBT-romance novels. Her books have hit USA Today‚Äôs best-seller list nineteen times , have been published in over a dozen languages, and are sold on five continents. Bowen joined us on September 30 to share how she went from Wall Street to writer, along with her best tips for pricing your books and writing series.

snippet.title: Amazon KDP Detail Page Linking
snippet.description:
This video explains how you can link your eBook, paperback, and hardcover books together into a single Amazon product detail page. You'll learn how KDP automates this process and what to do if the linking doesn't happen automatically. 

For more information, visit our Help article: https://kdp.amazon.com/help/topic/G200652220

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Michelle M. Pillow
snippet.description:
A romantic at heart, Michelle M. Pillow loves stories with a happy ending, imperfect characters, and good mysteries that are challenging to solve. Though she writes in many genres‚Äîand has sold a million books across them!‚Äîshe‚Äôs best known for her sci-fi and paranormal romances, mysteries, and paranormal women's fiction. On September 16, Pillow shared with us phenomenal marketing tips, including how she uses resources like Author Central and A+ content to create a strong book release.


Check out Michelle's blog for the tips she discusses in the webinar: https://michellepillow.com/amazon-kdp-university-with-michelle-m-pillow/. We are including this link for informational purposes only; Amazon does not endorse or sponsor any service provider, nor recommend one over another. This information is to help you find what works best for you.

snippet.title: KDP University @home with Andrew Watts
snippet.description: In 2012, while deployed on a USS Navy aircraft carrier, Andrew Watts took up writing as a way to occupy his free time. Fast-forward nearly a decade and Watts is now the owner of Severn River Publishing, which has published titles for over 20 authors. Drawing on his experience in the military and working in brand management for one of the world‚Äôs largest consumer-goods companies, Watts uses his discipline and marketing acumen to turn his projects into reality as a successful author and business owner. On September 2, Watts joined us to share his top tips for starting and growing your career as an indie author‚Äîfrom his unique perspective on both sides of the pen.

Tricia O‚ÄôMalley didn‚Äôt let living on a small Caribbean island stop her from becoming a global best seller. With over 2 million books read and spots on New York Times, USA Today, and Wall Street Journal best-seller lists, O‚ÄôMalley‚Äôs contemporary romances, paranormal romances, and cozy mystery novels stories have touched hearts all over the world. 
On August 19, O‚ÄôMalley and her business manager, joined us to share their top tips for a successful pre-order launch.

snippet.title: Cinematic lighting in Blender 2.9 / Eevee
snippet.description:
An informal Lightbox 2020 demo going over some tips and tricks for cinematic lighting/atmosphere in Blender 2.9. Uploading here for anyone who missed it for archiving purposes (before it gets deleted from Twitch). Will try to do this semi-regularly when time permits over on Twitch.  https://www.twitch.tv/benmaurodesign 

In the video i am using the Kitbash3D Sci-fi Industrial kit for a lot of the buildings, you can get 15% off any of their kits with the discount code: MAUROBASH
https://kitbash3d.com/

snippet.title: INKTOBER 2018: Blender + Photoshop Sketches / Experiments / Studies
snippet.description:
A couple sketches, studies, experiments from Inktober this year, trying to make an effort to post more videos now and then, hopefully wont be another 2 years before the next one! The first sketch of the Cobra was trying out some of Jama's Blender Greasepencil techniques to try to use as a blockout method before going into Photoshop for a more detailed line-drawing, still not 100% comfortable drawing in 3D yet. I condensed this part down a bit, if you want a full on tutorial for Blender/Grease Pencil definitely check out Jama's tutorials here, he goes over everything in detail: https://gumroad.com/jamajurabaev

The truck sketch was just straight drawing in Photoshop without any blender/3D stuff. The last image was a design i did earlier that started as a stratos zero study that turned into a more sci-fi looking design, this was also just all 2D, i didnt record the process but thought i would include a few steps from the rough sketch to final of that one. Enjoy!

snippet.title: Business/Art/Life Part 1
snippet.description:
Update: https://gumroad.com/benmaurodesign I added the rates section to the Gumroad version of the talk, so anyone that buys that version gets a little extra content (3-4 mins), i was planning to have that be the start of Part 2 but i need to put it on hold for a while to get some projects finished but wanted to make sure the rates section was out there in some form for now. You can also view this information in text form on my website in the advice section: http://benmaurodesign.com/Advice

A collection of thoughts and experiences from working in the entertainment industry, basically the sort of talk i wish someone gave to me before i started working. I hope this is useful to you all and helps you on your journey.

snippet.title: Ben Mauro - ZBrush for Environments
snippet.description:
In this video i go over the creation of a mech hanger set design in ZBrush using elements blocked out for my Massive Black workshop demo last year to construct a larger scene and render out compositions using Keyshot in order to do a detailed environment production painting in Photoshop that could be used for a next gen game or film. I go over the creation of the set and taking different shots before deciding on a final story moment and composition to refine in Photoshop to sell the idea to our imaginary client/director. Hope you enjoy the Doge, thanks for watching!

For more tutorials and resources from me, check out my gumroad:
https://gumroad.com/benmaurodesign#

Here was a link to James Paick's tutorial i was talking about:
http://www.conceptdesignworkshop.com/james-paick-vol1

Scott Robertson's Perspective and Matte Surface Shading tutorials:
http://cargocollective.com/drawthrough/DVDs

Here was a link to Vitaly's kitbash parts:
http://vitalybulgarov.com/3d-kitbash/

snippet.title: Ben Mauro - YUKON PIT CREW: PART 1
snippet.description:
Collab between myself and Vaughan Ling (HEAVYPOLY), going over a first design pass of a possible humanoid type character in the same aesthetic as his YUKON creature which could be part of pit crew team for some future racing event. 

Future videos could go over refinement of the character/tools they might use to service the YUKON creatures during repairs etc. as we go back and forth defining the world that Vaughan has in mind. Could also go over the building of the final 3D models and scene before 3D printing, and showing the final collectible design when its all wrapped up if you guys are interested, let me know in the comments. ;)

If you are interested in a 3D print of the YUKON design give Vaughan an email at: Heavypoly@gmail.com so he can get an idea of how many to print later on down the line which would be available through HEAVYPOLY Industries. 

For more badass stuff from Vaughan Ling check out his site:
http://www.heavypoly.com/

For more work from myself check out my personal site at:
http://www.benmaurodesign.com/

snippet.title: Ben Mauro - Future Soldier Photobash
snippet.description:
Production painting technique using photos as a base to produce detailed concept art quickly. We used this approach on most of our ELYSIUM art to generate multiple finished ideas each day. Trying to keep this in line with some of the other primate mech's i have been doing lately, though this guy would barely qualify as a 'light' trooper. Might take a crack at a heavy version in a cooler pose that has way more bulky/integrated exo-skeleton tech, would help give off more of the 'Gorilla' vibe in its overall proportion and stance, maybe for a future video if you guys are into this stuff? Let me know, enjoy the video!

More of my work here: http://www.artofben.com/

If you would like to get a more in depth look into other production techniques check out some of my more in-depth tutorials here: https://gumroad.com/benmaurodesign#

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes with ATEM Constellation 8K and SociallyU
snippet.description:
Andre Dantzler‚Äôs company, SociallyU, has been at the forefront of virtual production innovation for several years. A key element of their success is the use and integration of Blackmagic Design products. While SociallyU incorporates a variety of Blackmagic products in their workflow, it‚Äôs the ATEM Constellation 8K switcher that lies at the heart of their entire studio setup.
¬†
Learn more about ATEM Constellation 8K at http://bmd.link/jLyw9f

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes with Blackmagic Cloud and Hangman
snippet.description:
James Tonkin has been fortunate to work with David Gilmour of Pink Floyd for many years now. The BTS production was managed using Blackmagic Cloud, DaVinci Resolve and Blackmagic RAW workflows, using Blackmagic Cloud Stores to sync everything.

‚ÄúCameras live and die by their image quality and the best are the ones that give the closest parallel to how we used to capture traditional film. So whatever I am shooting, from a feature to a music documentary, I‚Äôll always use Blackmagic RAW combined with the Blackmagic Cloud and proxy workflow.‚Äù

Read the full story at http://bmd.link/AXxRf7

So whatever I am shooting, from a feature to a music documentary, I‚Äôll always use Blackmagic RAW combined with the Blackmagic Cloud and proxy workflow.‚Äù

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes with Blackmagic Camera and Ko–Øn
snippet.description:
The American metal band Ko–Øn wanted fan content as part of the documentation of their 30th anniversary concert. Ko–Øn‚Äôs official videographer, S√©bastien Paquet set up a new workflow using the Blackmagic Camera app and Blackmagic Cloud. 

‚ÄúThe Ko–Øn guys have always been technology savvy, so they immediately liked the Blackmagic Camera app to the Cloud idea for their fans. We had literally hundreds and hundreds of fans all wanting to be part of this project, and the Blackmagic Camera app being synced to Blackmagic Cloud was the way to make it all happen.

Read the full story at http://bmd.link/RWtJUq

snippet.title: Using the Music Remixer in DaVinci Resolve
snippet.description:
This short video explains how the music remixer tool works in DaVinci Resolve to adjust music to fit with the style of your show. You‚Äôll learn how to isolate and remix individual sounds, instruments or vocals at both the clip or track level.

The latest version of DaVinci Resolve can be downloaded from https://www.blackmagicdesign.com/products/davinciresolve.

snippet.title: Export Selection Extension/Addon for Blender
snippet.description:
If you don't see it in the list of extensions, it's because it has not been approved (yet) by the Blender Team. So you can get it straight from my GitHub. Follow the link and click on Save Selection in the release area to download it. Send me a message on YT or preferable on GitHub if you have any issues or suggestions. 

https://github.com/riouxr/SaveSelection

snippet.title: The secret life of a Blender developer ‚Äî BLENDERHEADS Ep. 8
snippet.description:
BLENDERHEADS - Ep.08 - Enjoy the eighth episode of Blenderheads, a series about the people behind the Blender project. In this episode, we get to know Sergey. We follow his transition from Lead Engineer to Head of Development. The editor and director ‚Äì documentary filmmaker Maaike Kleverlaan‚Äì works embedded in the Blender headquarters to cover the activities and conduct interviews. 

Support the future of Blender: https://fund.blender.org

--

snippet.title: What's New in Blender 4.4! Official Overview
snippet.description:
Jonathan Lampel from @cg_cookie presents everything new in Blender 4.4! Joined by @harryblends covering Geometry Nodes, @PCaggegi on Grease Pencil, and @waynedixon7280 from CG Cookie on what's new for Animation and Rigging.

‚û°Ô∏è Download Blender and read the release notes: https://www.blender.org/download/releases/4-4/

üß° Blender is made possible thanks to your donations at https://fund.blender.org

Thanks to everyone involved, developers, users reporting issues, content creators making documentation, donators and members of the Development Fund.

--

Follow Blender:
* Bluesky: https://bsky.app/profile/blender.org
* Instagram: https://instagram.com/blender.official
* Facebook: https://facebook.com/YourOwn3DSoftware
* TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@blender_org
* Mastodon: https://mastodon.social/@blender

--

00:00 Intro, Code Quality & Bug Fixes
00:30 Modeling, UV, Sculpt
02:15 Animation & Rigging
06:00 Geometry Nodes
09:27 Grease Pencil
12:26 Rendering
13:53 Compositing
15:01 Video Editing
15:54 User Interface
18:49 Python API
19:21 Import/Export
20:42 Outro, and thanks!

snippet.title: How to use Eevee - Full Blender Course
snippet.description:
This is a complete course for understanding how to use the Eevee rendering engine in Blender. Eevee is an (almost) real-time rendering engine. So you can render animation sequences in minutes rather than days with Cycles. This video will take complete beginners through everything they need to know to get started with Eevee. You'll learn the theory of how Eevee works, how to fix common problems, and how to optimize an Eevee scene for rendering.

===Linksüîó===

Poliigon Blender Addon: https://www.poliigon.com/blender?utm_campaign=eevee&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=bg

Blended Reflection Bug: https://projects.blender.org/blender/blender/issues/135198#issuecomment-1507735

=== Chapter Marks ‚úÇÔ∏è===
0:00 Intro
0:56 Modelling the room
2:01 Fixing Eevee light bleed
05:00 Why does Eevee have noise?
06:10 Increasing samples to specific areas
08:10 Adding reflections in Eevee
09:06 Fixing reflection artifacts
14:44 Intro to Reflection Probes
17:39 Spherical Probes
20:28 Light Bounces
26:00 Optimizing Raytracing
27:50 Improving GI Bounces
29:18 Introduction to Volume Probes (Baked Lighting)
35:05 Getting a perfect Volume Probe bake
42:21 Surfel Resolution
43:20 Using image textures 
47:26 Improving texture sharpness
48:28 Using HDRIs
52:44 Glass
57:05 Thin glass (cups and windows)
1:02:44 Volumetrics
1:04:06 What to do when volume probes look dark
1:06:48 Fixing World Light bleed
1:07:44 Fixing flickering alpha maps
1:08:50 Optimizing textures
1:11:35 Optimizing reflection probes
1:14:16 Sphere probe resolution
1:14:58 Raytracing optimizations

snippet.title: How to Texture in Blender - Full Course
snippet.description:
A full tutorial course on the fundamentals of texturing and shaders in Blender. Learn how to make a grungy brick wall for realistic environments.

What you'll learn:
0:00 Shader Fundamentals
5:50 Procedural Textures
09:05 Image Textures
13:20 The Importance of PBR Textures
17:09 UV Unwrapping
20:22 PBR Texture Setup
29:55 You're wrong about bumps!
40:20 Node Wrangler Addon
43:16 Poliigon Addon
45:30 Adjusting a texture
50:22 Breaking up repetition
1:03:20 Image texture painting
1:06:54 Vertex Painting
1:12:12 The "Color Burn Technique"
1:22:23 Using Decals
1:29:36 Wet leak patterns
1:36:40 A challenge
1:38:06 Efflorescence effect
1:40:50 Desaturation effect
1:44:33 Spalling effect
1:51:22 The final node setup

snippet.title: When you don‚Äôt want to build your 3d character from scratch‚Ä¶use a basemesh üí™ #blendertutorial
snippet.description:
The course BASEMESH is 25% off on Superhive Market - this weekend only (ends Monday, May 26th)

Do you want to build 3D characters but don't know where to start? Are you're overwhelmed by the thought of creating them from scratch? The default cube can be kind of intimidating...

This course is designed to give you a head start on the character creation workflow: Start with a BASEMESH! Reliable pre-made character models are not only an effective way to speed up the process and establish good topology early. The truth is, all your favorite pros use basemeshes too.

Sure they can also build characters from scratch - and we teach that elsewhere - but the efficiency of a basemesh makes it a standard tool for 3D character creation.

snippet.title: Why does triangulation matter? #b3d #mesh #3dtexture
snippet.description:
üí° Triangulation isn‚Äôt consistent across 3D software‚ÄîBlender, Maya or Unity may all handle it differently.

If you bake maps on a non-triangulated mesh, it can lead to shading errors later.

Always triangulate your low-poly mesh before baking to avoid issues.

localized.title: Why does triangulation matter? #b3d #mesh #3dtexture
localized.description:

Always triangulate your low-poly mesh before baking to avoid issues.

snippet.title: Normal maps: Do you know the difference between DirectX and OpenGL?
snippet.description:
üí° Normal maps simulate small surface details without adding geometry. But DirectX and OpenGL handle the Y-axis differently:

üëâ DirectX Normal Maps:

Y-axis (Green channel) points down
Typically use left-handed coordinate system
Green areas on the normal map might look darker.

üëâ  OpenGL Normal Maps:

Y-axis (Green channel) points up
Uses a right-handed coordinate system
Green areas usually appear lighter.

üéØ Why it matters:
If you use the wrong format in your engine or shader, lighting will look off‚Äîlike bumps are inverted. You can fix this by inverting the green channel if needed.

snippet.title: Hard Surface Modeling Tips - Better Boolean Subtractions in Blender
snippet.description:
Check out my course 3D Cars: Inside and Out on Gumroad, Blender Market, and Flipped Normals.
Gumroad - https://cgmasters.gumroad.com/l/3d-cars
Blender Market - https://www.blendermarket.com/products/3d-cars-inside-and-out-in-blender
Flipped Normals - https://flippednormals.com/product/3d-cars-inside-and-out-in-blender-32469?dst=b8XbGnH5

In this tutorial I'll give you a couple tips on how to get better results from the Boolean modifier. A lot can go wrong when you're creating cutouts with the Boolean modifier, but there are some useful solutions like changing the Solver, Overlap Threshold, and even modifying the cutout object to provide extra geometry to fix shading issues.

Check out https://cgmasters.com for more courses and tutorials.

snippet.title: 3D Cars: Inside and Out in Blender - Available Now!
snippet.description:
Check out the course on Gumroad here - https://cgmasters.gumroad.com/l/3d-cars

Or on Blender Market here - https://www.blendermarket.com/products/3d-cars-inside-and-out-in-blender

Here we go again, but this time the course is bigger, better, and there‚Äôs a whole lot of new stuff, including a full interior. My past car modeling training has been studied by industry giants like Hyundai and Volvo, as well as designers in top gaming and film companies all over the world. And now I‚Äôve taken those techniques and made them even better. In this step-by-step course we‚Äôll tackle an amazing car design by professional designer Lee Rosario, and I‚Äôll show you new ways to solve even the trickiest hard surface challenges with ease as we build this awesome car together from the first vertex to the final renders.

So join me in this car creation journey, and learn tons of techniques for hard surface modeling, shading, rendering, and compositing, all inside the free open source 3D software, Blender.

Thank you all for supporting my training, and if you check this one out I hope you like it!

And if you want to check out more of Lee's design work, you can see his projects here - https://www.behance.net/leerosario

snippet.title: Procedural Parallax Effect in Blender
snippet.description:
Learn how to create a procedural parallax effect using shader nodes in this Blender tutorial. Parallax mapping is a technique used to give a 2 dimensional surface a truly 3 dimensional look. It's different than bump mapping and normal mapping because parallax mapping creates the illusion of depth, not just surface detail. And this depth is based on the perspective too, creating a convincing 3 dimensional feel from every angle. This shader was originally made for this tutorial by Erindale Woodford. Check out more of his work here - https://linktr.ee/erindale.xyz

Download the project files here -
https://cgmasters.com/tutorials/parallax.zip

Check out the course Master Procedural Texturing in Blender -
https://www.blendermarket.com/products/master-procedural-texturing-in-blender

Check out https://cgmasters.com for more courses and tutorials.

Like the tutorial and want to leave a tip?
PayPal - https://www.paypal.me/cgmasterscom

Chapters:
0:00 - Introduction
0:47 - Getting Started
1:34 - Setting Up the Basic Shader
6:35 - Grouping the Nodes
10:48 - Starting on the Bottom Texture Layer
14:02 - Mixing Incoming Vectors and Position Coordinates
18:04 - Fixing the Distortion
22:14 - Mixing the Top and Bottom Texture Layers Together
26:34 - Adjusting the Brightness and Contrast
27:15 - Fake Refraction Effect
30:50 - Stretching the Bottom Layer Vertically
35:46 - Depth Fade Out Effect
38:43 - Seeing It All Together
40:20 - Conclusion and Course Trailer

snippet.title: 5 Awesome Procedural Texturing Tricks in Blender
snippet.description:
Check out our course "Master Procedural Texturing in Blender" here - https://www.blendermarket.com/products/master-procedural-texturing-in-blender

Download this tutorial's resource files here - https://cgmasters.com/tutorials/5_Awesome_Tricks.zip

In this tutorial I'll show you 5 awesome procedural texturing tricks that'll really come in handy for various situations. These tricks include rounding off tile corners, using linear light to distort textures without moving them out of place, directional and full blur effects for any texture node, and how to automatically round off angular beveled edges.

Check out https://cgmasters.com for more courses and tutorials.

Like the tutorial and want to leave a tip?

snippet.title: Master Procedural Texturing in Blender | Out Now!
snippet.description:
Check it out here - https://www.blendermarket.com/products/master-procedural-texturing-in-blender

Tap into the unlimited potential of Blender‚Äôs incredibly powerful node editor, and learn how to create advanced and highly customizable procedural textures from scratch. In this course I‚Äôll walk you through building complex textures, step by step. You‚Äôll learn about a ton of different nodes and creative ways you can combine them to achieve amazing results.

We‚Äôll focus on two big projects in this course, highly customizable Subway Tiles and an animated and customizable Lava Field. Both are fun and complex projects that will give us a good mix of both technical and organic styles of textures.

For this course I teamed up with procedural texture master Erindale Woodford. Erin created the textures and I created the training. We chose these specific topics to focus on important texture building skills like technical planning and texture layering to help you gain a strong understanding of how to approach and achieve complexity.

snippet.title: Blender for Complete and Total Beginners
snippet.description:
Blender for Complete and Total Beginners is the best starting point for anyone interested in learning 3D and Blender. Check out the course page to learn more - https://cgmasters.com/blender-for-complete-and-total-beginners/

Blender is perfect for anyone interested in learning 3D, because it‚Äôs incredibly powerful and free. This full creation suite offers a complete range of artistic possibilities, including modeling, animation, rendering, compositing, video editing, and a lot more. So whether you‚Äôre interested in creating games, producing animations, 3D printing, or anything else related to 3D, Blender has you covered with it‚Äôs complete production toolkit.

Learning such an advanced piece of software can be intimidating though. There are a crazy amount of tools and it can be tricky to figure out where to start. That‚Äôs what this course is for. This curriculum was designed to give you a clear understanding of the most fundamental concepts and tools, even if you have zero experience.

snippet.title: Blender Tutorial - Procedural Houndstooth Pattern
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Data Visualization in Blender and Python
snippet.description:
In this tutorial we'll create a script that reads data from CSV files(comma separate values) and converts it into a list of data that we can use to generate a bar graph. No prior python experience is needed to follow along, but I don't go over every aspect of the fundamentals of programming, so some experience would really help in understanding everything.

You can download the resource files for this tutorial here - https://cgmasters.com/tutorials/Bar_Graph_Resource_Files.zip

snippet.title: Exchanging guitars with Melodyne studio
snippet.description:
With our top-of-the-range edition Melodyne studio you can transfer the sonic character of one instrument to another. Like turning a Strat into more of a Les Paul ‚Äì or vice versa.

The underlying technology goes far beyond simple EQ matching, because only Melodyne has access to individual notes in audio files and can therefore translate the physical properties of an instrument into specific ‚Äúfingerprints‚Äù of overtone structures.

In this 10-minute video, Sensho demonstrates how to imprint these fingerprints from one guitar to the next. But of course you can do the same with other instruments, including the human voice.

0:00 Intro
0:37 Today‚Äôs audio example
1:48 The spectral overview
2:33 Applying tonal changes
3:33 Using spectrums from different guitars
5:15 Layers of original and new guitars
6:25 More character with Contour
7:32 Unifying different guitars
8:52 Final combination of all elements


For more on Melodyne: 
https://www.celemony.com

snippet.title: Note-based vocal FX in Melodyne
snippet.description:
To make a vocal sound unique and memorable, it helps to highlight the little special moments that each performance has to offer. In this video, Rich Crescenti uses Melodyne to create effects and unique workflows that enhance those specific moments, rather than simply changing the overall sound of the whole track. Get some inspiration for your next mixing session! 

By the way, everything Rich shows in this video can be done with Melodyne assistant and above ‚Äì except for the Sound Editor part at the end, which is exclusive to Melodyne studio.

0:00 Intro
0:50 Today‚Äôs musical example
1:12 Note-based chorus effect
2:40 Adjusting levels on the fly
3:14 Accessing hidden notes 
5:12 Harmonies that really work
6:25 Inverted modulation
6:57 Processing across tracks
9:03 Sound design in Melodyne studio

For more on Melodyne:

snippet.title: Nostra - Ethereal Sci Fi Background Music for Relaxation
snippet.description:
They said Nostra was once a weather station, perched atop the last outpost of the inland sea.

But that was before it woke.

Now it walks.

Welcome to Chronoscapes, your portal to captivating ambient music for every mood and moment.

Cinematic soundscapes that transport you to new worlds
Dark and mysterious ambiences for introspection
Relaxing and meditative melodies for peace and tranquility
Heavenly and ethereal textures for a sense of wonder
Sci-fi and futuristic soundscapes for imaginative journeys

I'm creating immersive experiences perfect for:

üò¥ Sleep and relaxation
üßò Meditation and mindfulness
üìö Reading and focus
ü§ì Studying and concentration
üè¢ Work and productivity

Whether you seek ethereal ambience, sci-fi soundscapes, or something in between, Chronoscapes got you covered.

snippet.description:

The project was done by Chinmay Bhogaonkar, Laurenz Simonis and Marian Dembkiewicz who are current and former students from Advanced Product Design at Ume√• Institute of Design.

snippet.title: CES 2024 - Raspberry Pi CEO Eben Upton on the evolution of his platform
snippet.description: In this video, John Skabardonis from Covestro speaks with Eben Upton, CEO of Raspberry PI. Upton notes how the use of Raspberry Pi hardware has evolved from prototyping into production. Their low cost computing hardware enables designers and engineers to deploy intelligence into the world at a much higher density than previously possible, opening the doors to a an opportunity-rich environment for innovation. Covestro's thermally conductive polycarbonate helps dissipate the heat generated by increasingly powerful PCBs.

snippet.title: CES 2024 - Altair Digital Twin technology
snippet.description: In this video, John Skabardonis from Covestro speaks with Ismail Benhayoun, Senior Technical Director for Product Design at Altair. Here they review a demo combining simulation, high-performance computing and AI to produce a 'digital twin' model of a product. Using Altair technologies, designers can combine photo-realistic visuals with high fidelity data models to trace the lifetime usage of a product and predict maintenance failures or point out any possible improvements to the design.

snippet.title: CES2024 The Designer's Perspective | Covestro
snippet.description: In this video, Niko Palosuo & John Skabardonis from @Covestro share design insights and experiences from CES 2024, featuring interviews and commentary from  Eben Upton (@raspberrypi), Chris Lefteri (Chris Lefteri Design), David Byron (@sundbergferar), Ismail Benhayoun (@AltairHowTo) and DC Smalley (@hailo2062). Now more than ever the combination of material innovations, advances in hardware, and AI are allowing designers to bring ideas to life in surprising ways and in unexpected places.

snippet.title: You Touch, You Buy.
snippet.description:
For the first time since 2017, I recorded the process behind one of my artworks. Much of what you can see in this short film was broadcasted live on Twitch. It shows my interpretation of Bobs workplace plus additional pieces that highlight the sticky and moldy nature of his business. Everything‚Äôs been touched before, nothing is new. Mint condition, but not really.

Thanks, love, praise & eternal glory goes out to:
Jasmin D√§mmrich, Alex Rych, Raphael Rau, Lukas Guziel, Ash Thorp, Billy Chitkin, Jeremy Cox, Dino Muhic and literally hundreds of people who were constantly cheering and supporting me with their knowledge, kindness and love during long days of streaming. I would love to make a list with all your names, but I can‚Äôt, because you were so many. I will never forget you though.

The project would not have been possible without the help of RNDR.
https://rendertoken.com/

Music by the glorious Lukas Guziel.
https://soundcloud.com/lukas-guziel
https://open.spotify.com/artist/6Saw1XvD0o49wr2R9B8zdi?si=sj-zClKPSBaM1tXaEnHIiA

snippet.title: Single Column Toolbox Layout for GIMP 3.0 | Beginners Tutorial
snippet.description:
In this GIMP 3.0 tutorial I show you how to adjust your GIMP toolbox so that it displays as a single column - just like Photoshop! Improve the UI of this free photo editor with my simple tutorial that's beginner friendly. I also show you how to return your layout back to the original or default GIMP layout (with Tool Options, Device Status, Undo History, and Images tabs underneath the GIMP toolbox). 

Visit our website for more text and video tutorials:
https://www.daviesmediadesign.com/tutorials/

snippet.title: Learn GIMP 3.0 Photo Editing for Beginners in 25 Minutes
snippet.description:
Learn how to edit photos from start to finish in GIMP 3.0, the free photo editor and photoshop alternative! This tutorial walks you through a simple yet effective 10 step process for creating AWESOME photos EVERY TIME! From adjusting exposure and shadows-highlights, to enhancing colors with levels and saturation, to adding contrast with curves, to sharpening and denoising, to cropping and exporting - I cover every important detail as a total beginner you need to know to edit great photos consistently. 

No Adobe subscription required! The GNU Image Manipulation Program is totally free and open source.

snippet.description:

People HATE the look of the brushes dialog, which appears by default, and really - if you think about it - it shouldn't even be a default dialog. I suggest a new setup that I think makes GIMP 3.0 look WAY better. Thoughts?

snippet.title: GIMP's Future After GIMP 3.0: Upcoming Features, $2 Million Funding
snippet.description:
Now that GIMP 3.0 has been released, what can we expect in the future for the GIMP project? In this video, I discuss news around GIMP development, including features expected in GIMP 3.2 like smart objects and vector layers! Plus, I discuss other exciting features on GIMP's radar like a vector Shape tool, full CMYK support, animation features, a built-in "inpainting" tool (from the Resynthesizer plug), and more!

Additionally, I cover a Libre Arts article that discusses GIMP's approx. $2 million in Bitcoin, which it began liquidating for cash through the Gnome Foundation. Will GIMP start hiring paid developers to implement awesome new features?

Visit our website for more text and video tutorials:
https://www.daviesmediadesign.com/tutorials/

snippet.title: What's New In GIMP 3.0
snippet.description:
GIMP 3.0 is finally here! In this video, I cover all the latest features found in the HIGHLY anticipated new GIMP 3.0 release for 2025. New features include non-destructive editing, CMYK support, multi-layer selection, outlined text (for stroking text) and other text tool upgrades, improved color space management, UI improvements and easier UI customization, smart guides, tool improvements, and much more!

See all the latest features found in this free photo editor and Photoshop alternative!

snippet.title: GIMP 3.0 Non-Destructive Editing Will Blow Your Mind ü§Ø
snippet.description:
GIMP 3.0 finally brings us non-destructive editing features! This means you can now add image adjustments or filters to your photo, then go back at any time during your workflow (or during a new session) and make edits, tweaks, adjustments, etc. to your effects. This new feature, located in the NEW Layer FX menu, is the most highly anticipated feature in GIMP of all time. GIMP rivals Photoshop once again!

Visit our website for more text and video tutorials:

snippet.title: Easy Glass Morphism Effect in Inkscape
snippet.description:
Learn how to create a simple glass morphism effect using Inkscape, the free and open source graphic design software! Make you designs look more professional when designing for user interfaces (UI) with this trick for more dynamic cards and text boxes. With this effect, your text will be more easily readable against complex backgrounds, while making your background look like its passing through glass.

Enroll in My Inkscape Course:
https://daviesmediadesign.com/inkscape-course/

snippet.title: dForce From Scratch With Chris Cox - Daz+ Pro Artist Series
snippet.description:
In this Daz+ Pro Artist stream, Chris shows us how to apply dForce from scratch on a dress he's created in Marvelous Designer. We'll learn how to apply the modifier, how to change cloth behavior for each surface, and how to create rigid follow nodes for parts we don't want to deform during the simulation.

CHAPTER POINTS
================
00:00 Holding Loop
17:10 Titles and Welcome
19:50 How Chris started with Daz Studio
26:50 What are Marvelous Designer and CLO
33:30 Chris turns an OBJ dress into a dForce dress
40:50 How Chris simulates dForce garments (lots of tips)
49:40 Assigning simulation properties per surface
1:07:50 dForce with a Pose and Custom Character
1:24:30 Creating a Rigid Follow node
1:38:30 Recap: using the Transfer Utility
1:43:50 Recap: adding dForce to the OBJ dress
1:47:50 Recap: fixing the Waistband in place
1:51:10 Using the high-res dress (5mm version)
1:57:20 Avoiding dForce Explosions with Bend Stiffness
2:02:00 Recap: Rigid Follow Node
2:10:50 Adding textures to the dress
2:17:00 Q&A and Goodbye

snippet.title: Volumetric Effects & VDB Animations - Daz+ Pro Artist Series
snippet.description:
In this Daz+ Pro Artist Series stream, Jay demonstrates how to work with VDB files in Daz Studio 4.20 to add incredible volumetric effects to your scenes. We'll talk about adding one-click ground fog, see how the new OpenVDB shader works, and as a special treat we'll try our hand at importing VDB animations from EmberGen.

54:10 Emissive Objects and VDBs

snippet.title: Daz to Roblox Exporter: Out Now
snippet.description:
The Daz to Roblox Exporter is a tool designed to simplify the process of transferring high-quality 3D characters from Daz Studio into Roblox. It automates essential steps like rig conversion, texture baking, and mesh segmentation, making it accessible for solo creators, indie developers, and anyone looking to bring detailed 3D models into the Roblox ecosystem.

With this exporter, you can:

- Convert Daz Genesis 9 characters into Roblox-compatible avatars
- Automatically generate texture atlases and modesty layers
- Optimize meshes for performance in Roblox Studio
- Export to both R15 and S1 rigs with ease

Get Started: www.daz3d.com/daz-to-roblox

For more information, tips, and more, check out our Roblox blog: www.blog.daz3d.com/daz-to-roblox-exporter-launch

snippet.title: AI Character Shape Generation with YellowSculpt and Daz 3D
snippet.description:
Unlock the power of AI-powered character creation in Daz Studio with YellowSculpt and Yellow Token Packs! 

YellowSculpt is a text-to-3D tool that transforms simple text prompts into fully formed Genesis 9 character shapes. By leveraging advanced, ethically-sourced AI, it provides artists with a fast and intuitive way to generate complex morphs, eliminating the need for time-consuming manual sculpting.

Each token lets you generate a unique Genesis 9 body shape with just a simple text prompt‚Äîfast, easy, and fully customizable.

Try it today in Daz Studio!

snippet.title: Nvidia GeForce RTX 5060 Review: Better Than PS5 GPU Perf - But 8GB Is Not Enough
snippet.description:
Nvidia didn't want reviewers to look at this product until launch - and it's clear there are problems with it. Put the RTX 5060 into a modern system supporting PCIe 4.0 or better and you can get performance that handily beats a PlayStation 5. However, this card is badly balanced - compute power is OK for the budget gamer but the lack of VRAM is problematic and the pared back PCIe interface spells trouble for those on the older system the card is most likely to be used with. Here is Rich's review.

Note: RTX 5060 Ti and RTX 3060 12GB are used in the main benchmark sections. There's a small error in the Forza section - the label reads 5060 Ti, but it is the 5060 benched there.

Eurogamer review with all the numbers: https://www.eurogamer.net/digitalfoundry-2025-nvidia-geforce-rtx-5060-review

snippet.title: Hogwarts Legacy Switch 2 Preview: A Huge Leap Over Switch 1, But What About Series S And PS4?
snippet.description:
From something of a current-gen console showcase, scaling down gracefully to last-gen hardware, Hogwarts Legacy is a fascinating game - all of which makes the upcoming Switch 2 version a fascinating proposition. So how much of an improvement is it over Switch 1 - and where does it sit in comparison to Xbox Series S and PlayStation 4? Oliver and Rich sit down for a chat.

snippet.title: DF Direct Weekly #214: No Switch 2 Launch Reviews? Next-Gen Xbox Using ARM + The "Forced RT" Debate!
snippet.description:
In this week's Direct, Rich, John and Alex discuss the strongly rumoured plans for NO Switch 2 launch reviews, along with apparent news that the next-gen Xbox will use ARM-based Snapdragon processors. Rich tests out our in-development VRR capture/analysis tools with Days Gone Remastered, measures the ongoing PS5 VRR stutter effect while Alex shares his excitement for Ubisoft's Assassin's Creed Shadows disclosures. Finally, John's excited about the new Backbone Pro controller - which is much more than just a mobile controller peripheral.

snippet.title: Doom: The Dark Ages - DF Deep Dive Review - The id Tech 8 Engine Is Stunning
snippet.description:
Doom: The Dark Ages sees id Software evolve its in-house technology, built specifically with current generation hardware in mind. In this special video, John goes in-depth on the new engine, delivering behind-the-scenes engine editor visualisations to illustrate the enhancements, going into depth on each key innovation - from RTGI to RT reflections, to physics enhancements, mass enemy hordes, animation and more. 

All gameplay footage captured on a Razer Blade 16 with AMD Strix Point CPU and Nvidia RTX 5090, with the video edited on the same machine.

snippet.title: DF Direct Weekly #213: Switch 2 Processor Analysed, GTA 6 'Gameplay', RTX 5060 Controversy
snippet.description:
Switch 2 mysteries are finally resolved as two independent analyses confirm an 8nm processor... with a twist. Meanwhile, Rich, Alex and Oliver debate the meaning of 'gameplay' with regards to Grand Theft Auto 6, Trailer 2 while the team compares notes on the Asus ROG Ally 2, Xbox Project Kennan leaks. Oliver stacks up Switch 2 Final Fantasy 7 Remake footage against the PS5 performance mode, while Nvidia's plan to launch RTX 5060 without any accompanying reviews does not go down particularly well with the team. 

Check out Geekerwan's excellent Switch 2 SoC analysis: https://youtu.be/3pr_V8rtzrE?si=49w5fd4OFfpyPLDM
Kurnal's Switch 2 SoC analysis is also well worth a look: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uzxA0SaqJ7Y

localized.title: DF Direct Weekly #213: Switch 2 Processor Analysed, GTA 6 'Gameplay', RTX 5060 Controversy
localized.description:
Switch 2 mysteries are finally resolved as two independent analyses confirm an 8nm processor... with a twist. Meanwhile, Rich, Alex and Oliver debate the meaning of 'gameplay' with regards to Grand Theft Auto 6, Trailer 2 while the team compares notes on the Asus ROG Ally 2, Xbox Project Kennan leaks. Oliver stacks up Switch 2 Final Fantasy 7 Remake footage against the PS5 performance mode, while Nvidia's plan to launch RTX 5060 without any accompanying reviews does not go down particularly well with the team. 

Check out Geekerwan's excellent Switch 2 SoC analysis: https://youtu.be/3pr_V8rtzrE?si=49w5fd4OFfpyPLDM
Kurnal's Switch 2 SoC analysis is also well worth a look: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uzxA0SaqJ7Y

Join the DF Supporter Program for pristine video downloads, behind the scenes content, early access to new videos, early access to DF Direct Weekly and much, much more: https://bit.ly/3jEGjvx

Go here to check out DF merch! https://store.digitalfoundry.net

Subscribe for more Digital Foundry: http://bit.ly/DFSubscribe

0:01:09 News 1: Switch 2 SoC examined under a microscope! 
0:22:00 News 2: Rockstar claims GTA 6 trailer is half gameplay
0:40:06 News 3: ROG Ally 2 and Project Kennan handhelds leak 
0:53:15 News 4: New FF7 Remake Switch 2 footage analyzed! 
1:05:24 News 5: Nvidia holding back RTX 5060 drivers until launch 
1:22:56 Supporter Q1: Should AMD continue to work on FSR 3? Will we get FSR 4 quality upscaling in GTA 6 on PS5 Pro?
1:28:04 Supporter Q2: Could we get a Switch 2 version of GTA 6? 
1:35:01 Supporter Q3: How will GTA 6 scale to Series S? 
1:42:18 Supporter Q4: What do you think of viewers using DF Direct as a sleeping aid?

snippet.title: Oblivion Remastered Revisited: All Consoles Have Big Problems - PS5/PS5 Pro + Xbox Re-Tested
snippet.description:
A second round of console testing for the Oblivion Remaster reveals the extent of the game's performance issues. Hitches, sub-60fps drops, crashes and uneven frame-pacing on its 30fps quality mode blight every platform, including PS5 Pro tested today. Also curious is the manner in which continuous play time affects performance on all console platforms.

snippet.title: DPLA Hub Spotlight: The New Michigan Memories
snippet.description:
Join us as we spotlight the recent relaunch of Michigan Memories, a website that allows users to search the online collections of cultural institutions all around the state. Michigan Memories is the Michigan-centric counterpart to the Digital Public Library of America (DPLA), and the new version offers support for exhibits and educational resources about the state of Michigan and the people who live there. Many of our DPLA hubs are initiatives with close ties to state-based memory portals, and Michigan‚Äôs challenges and learnings offer useful insight for the whole DPLA Network.

The Michigan Service Hub was created in 2015 as a collaborative project by the Library of Michigan, Wayne State University, the University of Michigan, Michigan State University, Western Michigan University, and the Midwest Collaborative for Library Services. The service hub works with archives, libraries, museums, and historical societies around Michigan to help them share their publicly accessible, online collections more widely through the DPLA and Michigan Memories. Funding for the new site was provided in part by the Institute of Museum and Library Services through the Library of Michigan.

Speaker:
Richard C. Adler is the coordinator of the Michigan Service Hub, part of the hub network of the Digital Public Library of America (DPLA). He has traveled around the state to meet with staff at cultural institutions and work with them to share their online collections with the DPLA and the newly rebuilt Michigan Memories.

snippet.title: DPLA Open Board + Community Meeting (March 20, 2025)
snippet.description:
Join the DPLA board for an open town hall-style community meeting as we review the progress we made in 2024 and early 2025.

We are planning updates from DPLA staff as well as our new Grants Committee and DPLAfest Committee, and will share more about how you can be part of launching the next phase of our work together.

Read more about our plans for the coming year: "Recommitting to DPLA‚Äôs Mission in 2025" (https://dp.la/news/recommitting-to-dplas-mission-in-2025)

snippet.title: Collaborating For Access: Does Digital Ownership Matter For Libraries?
snippet.description:
What if libraries could circulate ebooks the same way they circulate print books: one user at a time with the ability to transfer titles to other hosts and libraries as they see fit? Can this model, now offered by dozens of indie publishers to libraries nationwide, help us all better fulfill our missions in an increasingly digital space? 

In this Collaborating for Access webinar, the eighth in an ongoing series presented by COSLA, DPLA and ReadersFirst, we will discuss the recent announcement by DPLA and Independent Publishers Group of their groundbreaking agreement that now allows libraries to own, rather than merely license, digital books they acquire through the Palace Marketplace. But how much does digital ownership really matter? Join us to learn more about the new model, discuss why it is vital for libraries to own the digital items they collect, explore how ownership could reshape library digital collecting, and think about the future of circulation services. 

Moderator: Michael Blackwell, Director, St. Mary‚Äôs County Library

Speakers: 

Christina de Castell // Chief Librarian & CEO, Vancouver Public Library
Micah May // Director of Ebook Services, Digital Public Library of America  
Michael Weinberg // Executive Director, Engelberg Center on Innovation Law & Policy, New York University Law School
Richard Williams // Vice President, Independent Publishers Group

snippet.title: D-CRAFT Toolkit ‚Äî assessing use & reuse of digital collections
snippet.description:
Join us to learn more about D-CRAFT (Digital Content Reuse Assessment Framework Toolkit)! Anyone working with digital collections at galleries, libraries, archives, museums, or repositories may find this session useful.

Three members of the D-CRAFT project team (https://reuse.diglib.org/project-team/) will share project history and introduce the toolkit (https://reuse.diglib.org/toolkit/).

Our presenters are:

- Ranti Junus (Michigan State University)
- Ayla Stein Kenfield (University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign)
- Santi Thompson (University of Houston)

snippet.title: DPLA Webinar: Wikimedia Metrics and Tools
snippet.description:
Please join the DPLA Wikimedia Working Group (WWG) for an overview of metrics and tracking tools across Wikimedia Platforms. Together we will look at metrics and tools from across Wikimedia while offering advice for institutions currently involved in, or looking to get involved in the DPLA Wikimedia Pipeline, and related Wikipedia work and editing. The presentation will cover pipeline metrics, the Wikimedia events dashboard and using it for event/edit tracking, article assessment tools, and tools on Wikimedia Commons. Additionally, we will briefly discuss new WMF tools that are being developed. Attendees will hear from individuals and institutions with first hand experience with these tools, and will offer insight and advice on how to best utilize them for your personal or institutional editing and content goals. We will close the session with time for Q&A and discussion.

‚Äî Presenters:

‚Ä¢ Rachel Helps is the Wikipedian-in-residence at the Brigham Young University Library.
‚Ä¢ Evan Robb is Digital Repository Librarian at the Washington State Library
‚Ä¢ Christine Fernsebner Eslao is Metadata Technologies Program Manager at Harvard Library Information & Technical Services.
‚Ä¢ Jamie Flood is the Senior Wikipedian and Outreach Coordinator with the Agricultural Law Information Partnership at the United States Department of Agriculture National Agricultural Library
‚Ä¢ Giovanna Fontenelle is a Program Officer for the Culture and Heritage team at the Wikimedia Foundation.

The presenters have helpfully provided this list of links to the tools discussed in the presentation:

 ‚Ä¢ Wikimedia Commons Media contributed by DPLA  (https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Media_contributed_by_the_Digital_Public_Library_of_America)
 ‚Ä¢ MET Museum Report (https://www.metmuseum.org/articles/open-access-at-the-met-year-one)
 ‚Ä¢ massviews analysis (https://pageviews.wmcloud.org/massviews/?project=en.wikipedia.org)
 ‚Ä¢ GLAMorgan (https://glamtools.toolforge.org/glamorgan.html)
 ‚Ä¢ GLAMorous (https://glamtools.toolforge.org/glamorous/)
 ‚Ä¢ Event Metrics (https://eventmetrics.wmflabs.org/programs)
 ‚Ä¢ Programs & Events Dashboard (https://outreachdashboard.wmflabs.org/)
 ‚Ä¢ View it! Tool (https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/View_it!_Tool)
 ‚Ä¢ Item Quality Evaluator (https://item-quality-evaluator.toolforge.org/)
 ‚Ä¢ Integraality (https://integraality.toolforge.org/)
 ‚Ä¢ GLAM CSI project (https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/GLAM_CSI)
 ‚Ä¢ Commons Impact Metrics (https://wikitech.wikimedia.org/wiki/Commons_Impact_Metrics)

snippet.title: Quality Indicators for Open Educational Resources (OER)
snippet.description:
Join us for our first event in the Resourcefully Assessing ‚Äî Critical Approaches to Assessment series, hosted by the Outreach & Assessment working group. This series will explore a variety of assessment strategies for different resource and collection types. In this coffee chat, Joanna Schimizzi will discuss quality indicators for Open Educational Resources (OER). We‚Äôll share example resources, rubrics, and templates that support you in finding and evaluating OER, with a focus on primary source sets. Part of the conversation will of course focus on student needs and on the opportunity to customize and localize resources to build robust sets of work.

Joanna Schimizzi is a Biology teacher in North Carolina and a Professional Learning Specialist with ISKME. While getting her Master‚Äôs in Education from Northeastern University, she became extremely interested in classroom culture and student identity. This led her to work with ISKME and OER Commons to support educators in finding Open Educational Resources (OER) so that resources can be modified and remixed to include a wider variety of perspectives and experiences. Joanna is mom to two boys and lives with her husband in a little town outside of Charlotte, NC.

Slides: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vQ4dOXfuv99z74g-s74UcJKviVP2hZMVr5A8fDsKf6LKA7F6UlUIrDI_e_FZYyzprYM4iY5SGlSDcgQ/pub

snippet.title: Reconciling Metadata with OpenRefine
snippet.description:
Does your metadata contain values that don‚Äôt align with controlled vocabularies commonly used in the GLAM sector? Learn how to reconcile metadata with OpenRefine, a popular data cleaning tool that can help you with metadata prep for DPLA. The Outreach & Assessment and Metadata Working Groups invite you to join this session, which builds upon February‚Äôs Introduction to OpenRefine presentation. Attendees will:

- Understand the basics of reconciliation with OpenRefine
- See examples of reconciliation with commonly used vocabularies such as the Art & Architecture Thesaurus‚Ñ¢
- Get pointers on untangling data, such as removing duplicate values

This meeting will be led by Helen Baer, Digital Projects Librarian at Colorado State University, a member of the Plains to Peaks Collective. No software pre-installation will be required by participants. Please feel free to reach out to Helen if you have specific use cases or controlled vocabularies you‚Äôd like her to focus on at this event.

snippet.title: Introduction to Standardized Rights Statements
snippet.description:
Curious about standardized rights statements? Standardized rights statements help increase access and reuse of your items. By providing rights in the form of a machine-readable URI, users can facet on rights in the DPLA interface and open access items can be shared by DPLA to Wikimedia Commons. Want to learn how to apply them to your digital collection?

Join the DPLA Rights Statements Working Group for an introduction to standardized rights statements. RightsStatements.org statements are a simple, standardized system of labels that more clearly communicate the copyright and re-use status of digital objects to the public. Adding these labels to your digital collections will improve usability and access for users. Presenters for this webinar will include members of the DPLA Rights Statements Working Group, many of whom are currently implementing rights statements for the collections they manage. They will share their expertise and experiences, as well as a wide range of resources for implementation.

snippet.title: Klukai finally lets loose (animation) - Girls' Frontline 2: Exilium x DillonGoo

snippet.title: Albedo's Last Fight // PROGENITOR EPISODE 5 - Genshin Impact x DillonGoo
snippet.description:
Mona cannot forget her past with L-1. But as L-1 fights the entire group of heroes at once, she must bring herself to destroy him or be destroyed. But is it even possible to destroy the progenitor of synthetic humans?

#HoYoFair #Genshinimpact #HoYoDetective #SavePaimon #animation 

Solve mysteries to uncover the truth and save Paimon! - https://hoyo.link/2O7lFQAL

snippet.title: How to Draw Awesome Stylized Characters from Reference!
snippet.description:
In this video, I‚Äôm going to take you through every single step and decision I make to draw an animated stylized character a reference photo!  We're starting completely from scratch, and you get to see every mistake I make, and how I solve them.

Being a good artist is all about curating what you decide to show your viewer. Drawing from photographs can be overwhelming because they are filled with unnecessary details that can distract you. The goal is to filter these out and constantly remind yourself to draw something that looks good, and communicates exactly what you want.

snippet.title: Why I am done making Realistic Art.
snippet.description:
Realistic or Hyper-realistic styles just don't seem to do it for me anymore. With the advancements in AI technology alongside the struggles that we face sharing our work on social media, Ive decided to focus on a more relatable approach. Simplifying my style while emphasising expression is not only a more effective use of my time as an independent artist, but gives me such a profound sense of fulfillment that I wanted to share my thoughts and experiences with everyone!

snippet.title: Drawing without expectations is tough but worth it!
snippet.description:
In this video, Im just taking a more relaxed, old-school approach‚Äîjust drawing and chatting. The overall focus is the challenge of creating without expectations. I share how loosening up, trusting the process, and embracing "happy accidents" can lead to more fluid, expressive art while building confidence in your style. If you're struggling with perfectionism in your work, try letting go, making bolder strokes, and seeing where the journey takes you!  

The song at the end is "OX1 (Oscar Mulero Remix)" by Tommy Four Seven.

snippet.title: 20th Anniversary of Evermotion - LIMITED TIME FREE Scene
snippet.description:
Evermotion 20th Anniversary Scene Trailer - a house in the forest was prepared with attention to detail so you can use it as inspiration, training material or a base for your own visualization projects.

The scene was prepared in 3ds Max 2024 with Corona 12, V-ray 7 and requires Forestpack 9.2.0 to work. It consists over 400 individual models like greenery, cars, furniture and more. Materials are prepared in PBR standard and everything is ready to render.

FREE FOR A LIMITED TIME: Download this scene from Evermotion Shop: https://evm.link/20

snippet.title: Trees Collection  for ArchViz - Archmodels vol. 299
snippet.description:
Archmodels vol. 299 is a collection of 60 models of popular tree species. You will find here such species as Quercus Robur, Betula Pendula, Acer, Alder, Tilia and Populus. The trees are made in summer and autumn versions.

The models come in multiple versions: Hi Poly for maximum detail in visualizations and films, Mid Poly balancing quality and performance for AAA and VR, Low Poly optimized for large CG worlds, and Very Low Poly for lightweight backgrounds.

Available formats: max | fbx | obj | c4d | blend | usd

Collection is available here: https://evm.link/am299

Archmodels vol. 298 brings you over 200 models in 14 sets of modern hotel and lounge furniture. You'll find here sofas, chairs, tables, poufs, lamps and chandeliers. In addition to the furniture, you'll find small props such as books, decorations, lighting, and more. The furniture's versatile design allows for use in any contemporary public space, ensuring maximum customization to suit your needs. 

Collection in Evermotion Shop: https://evm.link/AM298

snippet.title: Complete Apartment - Archinteriors vol. 17
snippet.description:
Archinteriors for UE vol. 17 contains a complete apartment interior in a minimalist style. Over 120 objects, including products such as furniture, plants, carpets and household appliances, as well as smaller props and accessories. This apartment includes a kitchen-living room area, bedroom, dressing room, and bathroom. Archinteriors for UE vol. 17 is made of modules and you can arrange it yourself. Scene contains predefined settings for rendering still images in Pathtrace quality.

See Archinteriors for UE5 vol. 17 in Evermotion Shop: https://evm.link/AIUE17
Archinteriors for UE5 vol. 17 on FAB Marketplace: https://evm.link/aiue17fab

You can find out how to use Pathtrace in our video tutorial.

snippet.title: Lounge Furniture Sets for ArchViz - Archmodels vol. 297
snippet.description:
Archmodels vol. 297 collection consists of over 200 models combined into 20 stunning sets of contemporary office lounge furniture. In addition to furniture, you'll find small props such as office equipment, lighting, and more. By choosing furniture that combines comfort, durability, and aesthetics, companies can create a space where employees feel appreciated, energized, and inspired to perform at their absolute best. 

The models have PBR materials and are ready for rendering, we also provide the scene prepared in Corona and Vray from 3dsmax and Cycles for Blender.

Archmodels vol. 297 in Evermotion Shop: https://evm.link/gYHz

snippet.title: Minimalist apartment scene - Archinteriors vol. 68
snippet.description:
Inside Archinteriors vol. 68 you will find a complete studio apartment made in a contemporary, modern style. The product consists of more than 200 models including furniture, flowers, household appliances and small props, typical for this kind of interiors. All models were made with attention to the smallest details and are selected to reflect well the contemporary style. The apartment consists of a living room with kitchen, bedroom and bathroom.

This product is made in a modular way - it gives the possibility of adaptation and reuse according to your needs.

If you do not need a ready-made scene we have prepared a model pack option. All models are made with PBR materials and the scene is ready to render out of the box. The scene is available in Corona and Vray for 3ds Max and in Cycles for Blender.

Get Archinteriors vol. 68: https://evm.link/AI68

snippet.title: Polyphony Without Spaghetti: TipTop Audio ART Modular
snippet.description:
I love new music technology. When I heard about TipTop Audio's new ART system that allows for polyphonic pitch, gate and velocity information to be transferred via regular patch cables and their own multi-tip USB style cables, I was intrigued. I never thought of Eurorack as being a fun tool for polyphony, as it requires a lot of modules and a spaghetti mess of connections. Can this tech change that? 

Get 7 Decent Sampler Instruments from this instrument and more: 
https://www.patreon.com/hainbach

MY SIGNATURE SOFTWARE: 
THE HAINPACK IS HERE: https://www.audiothing.net/bundle/hainpack/
GRANULAR SYNTH: https://apps.apple.com/de/app/fluss-granular-playground/id6443472888

FASHION: http://teespring.com/de/stores/hainbach
CONNECT: http://reddit.com/r/hainbach

BUY THE GEAR I USE (EU):
https://redir.love/thocf/n2lm9oo2ym
BUY THE GEAR I USE (US):
https://bit.ly/3nsnE9Q
(affiliate links, I get a few % if you buy through them)
BUY THE GEAR I USE (UK)
https://www.gear4music.com/blog/what-gear-does-hainbach-use/

snippet.title: Salad Mug - DYNAMO DREAM, Ep1 Pt1
snippet.description:
Feels so good to finally post this! Unending thanks to all the friends who worked to help make this happen, and all of the folks over on the patreon! 

A lot changed over the course of making this episode (you can probably feel it), and while I'm really excited about this episode, I'm even more excited to keep everything moving for the next bit; the big goal is to be able to finish these things a bit faster than every 3 years :P 

Thanks so much for watching- I hope you enjoy it. 

If you DID enjoy it and want to chip in a bit financially for future episodes, I've documented a ton of the process (and shared a bunch of assets) over on my Patreon. Mostly VFX/blender tutorials and such, but also more general breakdowns, too, and I'd of course love to see you there. 
http://www.patreon.com/IanHubert

Also, HUGE thanks to Impossible Acoustic for being down to take on this project! The degree to which the audio sculpts the end experience here is absolutely wild. 
https://www.impossibleacoustic.com

Composited in After Effects, 
All 3d work in Blender (blender.org)

Huge thanks again, to everyone :D

snippet.title: HyperBole! The Hyperball Hates You
snippet.description:
www.patreon.com/IanHubert
Finally finished this up! Sorry to anyone who thought it was going to be longer; that'd be a blast some day, but this got it out of my system for now :) 

Solid mix of hand animated stuff, physics sims, and data from a Rokoko mocap suit (learned a ton about IK rigging, too, to mix it all up)!

Music by Wilbert Roget II
Thanks to the Photoscanned Models, 
Sean Farbolin, Kaitlin Romig, Johnny Valencia, Nate Taylor, Ian Hubert

Made in blender, with some After Effects postwork

snippet.description:
https://www.patreon.com/IanHubert
Extended Version Here: https://youtu.be/I6xOT17NtRQ
Just a quick intro to IK rigging! It's probably the most useful thing I learned last year (after putting it off for, like, literally a decade and a half). 

Also- Been working like a wildman on Dynamo Dream. Sending it to the sound team in the next few days, then I'll be able to make a few more tuts! Have some stuff I'm really excited to talk about!

snippet.title: VFX Breakdown - Dynamo Dream Teaser
snippet.description:
First Episode Here: https://youtu.be/LsGZ_2RuJ2A

Hoh man- the little compressed instagram version of this breakdown has been reposted so many times I figured it'd be good to release a version with a couple more pixels!

I've been really excited about this type of workflow in terms of what it means for making crazy films in a garage, and I've been experimenting a bunch with it in the months since (tons of viewport compositing in Blender. All the CG stuff in this video is blender's realtime eevee engine, which has just been a blast). I've been posting lots of breakdowns/tuts/experiments on the patreon (thank you to everyone over there!):
https://www.patreon.com/IanHubert
Although I'm still working on full-on- tutorials I'll be posting here for everyone pretty quick. Almost done! Bit off more than I could chew for a minute here :P

The original Dynamo Dream teaser: 
https://youtu.be/qG31WSioSxk

snippet.title: Lighter Darker | EP 019: Severance
snippet.description:
Production designer Jeremy Hindle and visual effects supervisor Eric Leven join us to talk through their work on Severance season two. We discuss merging practical designs with the often invisible digital effects to create the atmosphere and environments of the Lumon world.

Listen wherever you get your podcasts: https://www.ilm.com/lighterdarker/019-severance/.

Chapter Markers
[00:00:11] Intro
[00:01:55] Rejection Letters
[00:06:52] Severance
[00:52:52] The Martini
[01:00:43] Outro

snippet.title: Lighter Darker | EP 017: ILM 50th Anniversary Panel
snippet.description:
How did John Knoll decide to pitch the story for Rogue One? What does Rob Coleman recall about the audience‚Äôs reaction to Yoda‚Äôs first lightsaber fight? What was it like for Fon Davis on his first pyrotechnic model shoot on the Star Wars prequels? How did Masa Narita decide to quit his job as a businessman in Japan and become an artist at ILM in San Francisco? You‚Äôll hear all these stories and more in Episode 17 of Lighter Darker, featuring ILM‚Äôs exclusive video coverage of our 50th anniversary panel at Star Wars Celebration Japan, now on YouTube.

The transcript and show notes with links to topics from this episode can be found at https://www.ilm.com/transcripts/017-fifty-years-of-ilm-panel/
