snippet.title: Celebrate Star Wars on Meta Quest
snippet.description:
Celebrate the best of Star Wars on Meta Quest with Vader Immortal: A Star Wars VR Series, Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy‚Äôs Edge, and a special first look at Star Wars: Beyond Victory, currently in development.

Star Wars: Beyond Victory - A Mixed Reality Playset takes place around the time of Solo: A Star Wars Story and offers three distinct modes for fans to enjoy: 

Adventure: Using a combination of virtual and mixed reality, the story follows Volo ‚Äì an aspiring podracer whose life gets flipped upside down under the mentorship of the infamous Sebulba.
Arcade: Experience the thrill of podracing in mixed reality on a virtual holotable that brings players right into the heart of the action like never before.
Playset: Transform the physical world around you and create your very own incredible Star Wars moments in mixed reality with a collection of unlockable virtual action figures and vehicles.

Vader Immortal: A Star Wars VR Series is our award-winning three-part series that combines immersive cinematic storytelling with dramatic interactive play. Explore the world of Darth Vader with Meta Quest.

Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy‚Äôs Edge is an action-adventure experience where you‚Äôll take on the role of a droid repair technician operating near the Outer Rim. When a group of pirates attack you on Batuu, you‚Äôll discover that anyone in the galaxy can become a hero.

For more information on immersive ILM experiences, follow us on Facebook, X, and Instagram.

Links:

Star Wars: Beyond Victory - A Mixed Reality Playset -  https://www.meta.com/experiences/star-wars-beyond-victory/9460903453969753/?srsltid=AfmBOor4-E-I1kGu5MbRHADqcW5d5oZcZ-bOO_5F5VEpd4D_PJ9XZOST

Vader Immortal: A Star Wars VR Series -  https://www.meta.com/quest/vader-immortal/

Star Wars: Tales from the Galaxy‚Äôs Edge - https://www.meta.com/experiences/star-wars-tales-from-the-galaxys-edge/3484270071659289/

snippet.title: Lighter Darker | EP 16: Bryce Dallas Howard
snippet.description: On Episode 16 of Lighter Darker: The ILM Podcast, Bryce Dallas Howard joins us to talk about her experience and process as an actor and a filmmaker. She shares some of her earliest childhood memories of visiting film sets, to revealing a few secrets regarding the famed Darksaber.

snippet.title: Introducing Velvet, A smarter de-esser for smoother vocals | iZotope
snippet.description:
Soften harshness without touching tone using the Sibilance channel‚Äôs fully featured 6-band dynamic EQ. Say goodbye to guesswork in one click, instantly identifying sibilant frequencies and setting up EQ nodes with the Learn button. Adaptively shape vocal tone by independently lifting and taming your vocals towards one of 8 target profiles, then transparently remove distracting mouth sounds, pops, and clicks with a single fader. Packed with features to help you dial in your sound, Velvet makes it simple to refine, reshape, and revive vocals from raw to flawless.

Get Velvet: https://www.izotope.com/en/products/velvet/?&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=velvet&goal=media_views&segments=improvers_amplifiers&utm_content=youtube_organic_introducing_velvet

snippet.title: Muted Bass on the Moog! | My Moog Sub37 Signature Pack!|
snippet.description:
Get the Pack here: https://johnmike.net/products/moog-subsequent-37-preset-pack

get loop elements pro here:
https://gospelproducers.com/product/loop-elements-pro-vst-au-aax-plug-in/

24 Custom-Designed Presets for Moog Subsequent 37

Enhance your Moog Subsequent 37 experience with this exclusive collection of 24 meticulously crafted presets. Designed for musicians and producers seeking rich, dynamic sounds, this pack offers a diverse range of tones to elevate your music production.

Features:

24 unique presets tailored for the Moog Subsequent 37

Includes basses, leads, pads, and experimental textures

Optimized for live performance and studio sessions

Easy installation with plug-and-play functionality

Requirements:

Moog Subsequent 37 synthesizer

Firmware version 1.2 or higher

Installation Instructions:

Connect your Moog Subsequent 37 to your computer via USB.

Open the Moog Editor/Librarian software.

Import the preset pack file into the librarian.

Transfer the presets to your synthesizer's memory banks.

Note: Ensure your synthesizer's firmware is up to date to guarantee compatibility.

snippet.title: Dark Funk Bass | My Moog Sub37 Signature Pack!|
snippet.description:
Get the Pack here: https://johnmike.net/products/moog-subsequent-37-preset-pack

get loop elements pro here:
https://gospelproducers.com/product/loop-elements-pro-vst-au-aax-plug-in/

24 Custom-Designed Presets for Moog Subsequent 37

Enhance your Moog Subsequent 37 experience with this exclusive collection of 24 meticulously crafted presets. Designed for musicians and producers seeking rich, dynamic sounds, this pack offers a diverse range of tones to elevate your music production.

Features:

24 unique presets tailored for the Moog Subsequent 37

Includes basses, leads, pads, and experimental textures

Optimized for live performance and studio sessions

Easy installation with plug-and-play functionality

Requirements:

Moog Subsequent 37 synthesizer

Firmware version 1.2 or higher

Installation Instructions:

Connect your Moog Subsequent 37 to your computer via USB.

Open the Moog Editor/Librarian software.

Import the preset pack file into the librarian.

Transfer the presets to your synthesizer's memory banks.

Note: Ensure your synthesizer's firmware is up to date to guarantee compatibility.

snippet.title: Print Shop Update, Whats next?
snippet.description: A much needed update on whats going on. There are an infinite number of directions that a business can go in the future and it can be overwhelming. I choose to be excited to see what happens. I'm planning on investing in three areas. Some sort of software to increase efficiency. Additional people to help get work done faster. More printing capacity to speed up printing during busy times. Wohoo!

snippet.title: Getting Your Landscape Deadly Sharp from Front to Back, Using Photoshop
snippet.description:
Want everything in your travel and landscape shots sharp enough to make your lens blush? In this tutorial, Scott Kelby walks you through focus stacking step-by-step‚Äîfrom in-camera tricks to Photoshop‚Äôs sneaky-smart auto-masking magic. You'll learn how to blend multiple focus points into one gloriously sharp image, without lifting a single masking brush. It‚Äôs easier (and cooler) than you think.

snippet.title: Modular DJing with Traktor X1 and Z1 | Native Instruments
snippet.description:
Whether you're just getting started or already rocking festival stages, modular DJing is all about flexibility, portability, and creativity. This is a customizable approach to DJing that uses individual modular controllers instead of an all-in-one setup. 

Traktor Z1 is a compact mixer with in-built soundcloud for mixing and queueing.

Traktor X1 is a compact controller for deck and effects control, playback manipulation, looping, mixer mapping, and more.

See the controllers: https://www.native-instruments.com/en/catalog/dj/?&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=traktor&goal=link_clicks&segments=energisers&utm_content=modular_djing

Learn more about Traktor Pro 4 software: https://www.native-instruments.com/products/traktor/dj-software/traktor-pro-4/?&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=traktor&goal=link_clicks&segments=energisers&utm_content=modular_djing

Advanced DJ setups using the Traktor X1 MK3:
https://youtu.be/WaFI57fCFzw?si=oVDnXP69T85dLsaO

Chapters:
00:00 - Modular performance
01:34 - Intro
02:12 - X1 and Z1 performance breakdown
04:22 - Expanding your modular DJ set
07:29 - Customizing your modular controllers
09:50 - Outro

Introducing Circular ‚Äì an expressive polyphonic sequencer that transforms simple chords into evolving, cinematic textures. With four fully independent layers and deep modulation control, Circular brings rhythm, movement, and emotion to every note.

Import your own samples, or explore over 100 experimental sound sources, from felted pianos to bowed metals, all designed to move, shift, and unfold in real time.

snippet.title: Crosstalk Modular walkthrough | Native Instruments
snippet.description:
Crosstalk Modular combines modular samples with the unique layering and processing options of the Crosstalk engine. It was developed exclusively for NI by 10 Phantom Rooms who captured the sounds by wiring tons of modules from boutique gear builders. These samples were then transformed into an innovative instrument with features you won‚Äôt find anywhere else, like real-time morphing and creative sound pumping (aka crosstalking) for all four individual sound layers. Dive into a blend of vintage and modern processing powers and create sounds you‚Äôve never heard before!

Discover Crosstalk Modular: https://www.native-instruments.com/products/nks-partners/10-phantom-rooms/crosstalk-modular/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=crosstalk+modular&utm_content=youtube+organic_crosstalk+modular+walkthrough¬†

snippet.title: Introducing Scene: Nightshade | Native Instruments
snippet.description:
Meet Nightshade, part of the Scene series ‚Äì a collection of lightweight, cinematic tools crafted for media composers. Featuring over 100 horror-inspired presets, Nightshade blends eerie synths, droning strings, and haunting choir textures to summon unsettling soundscapes. From ghostly whispers to deep, cinematic swells, it‚Äôs perfect for effortless scoring of fear, tension, and suspense.

snippet.title: It's FUN to do BAD THINGSüòë: Roland Space Echo
snippet.description:
*Subjective opinions within, those who do not understand subjective opinion may be excused lol*

Spotify - https://open.spotify.com/artist/26vuJBimPaYJEvRGUQgvir?si=U63pajr1QQ-8IQD86m5cgQ

SUPPORT THE CHANNEL AND GET YOUR GEAR WITH Zzounds EASY PAYMENT PLANS:

*98% music in this video is process through the Roland Space Echo composed/produced by me.
*1% Way Huge Supa Puss
*1% Song from my album lol

This is the story of how I went from a struggling all digital plugins musician, to an awesome amazing one just by adding a 40 year old vintage piece of gear........lol
JK, this is how to ruin your life by buying a Roland Space Echo thinking it's everything I wanted, and realizing it's just like almost every other vintage synth or effect.  It's a hit or miss nightmare.

snippet.title: Arturia Astrolab - Ok King
snippet.description:
*Subjective opinions within, those who do not understand subjective opinion may be excused lol*

SUPPORT THE CHANNEL AND GET YOUR GEAR WITH Zzounds EASY PAYMENT PLANS:
https://bit.ly/3zv9UhY

*100% music in this video composed/produced by me.

Remember, pick what's best for you, the Arturia Astrolab is an amazing piece of hardware, BUT, I've owned and played quite possibly every live keyboardists keyboard and so some of the things I say will seem knit picky, but the Astrolab I feel is positioned as the perfect hybrid... it's less aimed at the touring player, but more at the performer player/producer player... someone who is keen on hearing the magic of the studio on the stage.  

That said, yes, this is from a live players perspective, I'm not a journalist or enjoy being a highly technical reviewer, those videos will be available, as a musician this is from my POV as to what works and what doesn't

snippet.title: Great Synth Mysteries Ep. 6: There will NEVER be another Access Virus
snippet.description:
*Subjective opinions within, those who do not understand subjective opinion may be excused lol*

SUPPORT THE CHANNEL AND GET YOUR GEAR WITH Zzounds EASY PAYMENT PLANS:
https://bit.ly/3zv9UhY

*100% music in this video composed/produced by me.

This is a love story about a synthesizer unlike many others, in my opinion a synth that came out so long ago still eclipses many releases of today.  Great Synth Mystery, mmm, maybe... but I wanted to make a compelling piece about such a wonderful instrument.  As a musician and not a reviewer or journalist I think this really speaks to how ahead of it's time the Access Virus Ti was.

snippet.title: Kwesi Christian, Senior IT Support Analyst (Global Service Desk) | Life @ OCLC
snippet.description:
Kwesi Christian helps empower OCLC‚Äôs teams by providing them with the latest hardware and software tools and resources they need to deliver on their promise to libraries. He talked with us about the importance of his role, as well as how libraries supported him during his childhood and continue to create lasting impacts in his life (and the lives of others) today.

Want to be part of OCLC‚Äôs technology with a purpose? Learn about the impacts we make, our company culture, and available career opportunities at http://oc.lc/careers.

---------------------

Life @ OCLC: We are librarians, technologists, researchers, pioneers, leaders, and learners. With thousands of library members in more than 100 countries, we come together as OCLC to make information more accessible and more useful. Our people make us special. We make it easier and faster for people to access the world‚Äôs knowledge, and we create a thriving culture that enables us to deliver on our inspiring mission.
 
---------------------

snippet.title: Connect more people to your library
snippet.description:
OCLC‚Äôs web visibility program makes it easier for people to connect to libraries from search engines and nonlibrary websites where they usually begin their searches. The program now includes direct links to ebook and print book records in library catalogs from Google Search results. Learn more at oc.lc/visibility.

snippet.title: Introducing the "Library Collaboration as a Strategic Choice" OCLC Research report
snippet.description:
In this short video, Brian Lavoie, Senior Research Scientist, introduces the OCLC Research report he authored, "Library Collaboration as a Strategic Choice: Evaluating Options for Acquiring Capacity."

This report explores library collaboration as a key strategy for academic libraries in acquiring needed capacity, but also contextualizes it as one sourcing approach among a range of options available to libraries. You'll come away with insights and resources that can help your academic library think about whether and how to choose collaborative options that meet your strategic goals.
 
‚û°Ô∏è Download and read the full report here: http://oc.lc/strategic-collaboration

snippet.title: Office Hours | Friday | May 23, 2025
snippet.description:
We are here every day to answer your questions about media and production!

Submit your questions anytime https://www.askofficehours.global
Join our global community https://officehours.global

Markers are currently valid with countdown in place...

00:00:00 Intro
00:04:36 Show start
00:04:42 When I started streaming, there was RTMP. Then HLS came along. Now there are WHEP, QUIC, RIST, and ZIXI. When is it better to use one protocol over another?
00:07:56 Need a 1U rackmount PDU recommendation for a portable video cart powered by an EcoFlow RIVER Pro (720Wh). It‚Äôll run small gear: Rodecaster Duo, 15‚Äù monitor, Magewell Director Mini.
00:10:11 I am trying to setup a back channel in vMix using a GOXLR with Zoom.us. Is there a way to be able to talk with people on Zoom without it going live on vMix? My plan B is just logging into Zoom on my phone and talk with the speaker before they go liv
00:11:27 Disney+ or Netflix? I'm more of a documentary and music fan. which would have a better selection of that content?
00:15:05 Any issues with your Mac audio or editing apps when upgrading from Ventura to Sonoma? I'm willing to drive my M1's up the 101 this weekend but not head into the mountains and valleys of Sequoia until I get an M5! - [link]
00:20:34 Speaking of AI, have you tried Clippy AI assistant yet? Felix Rieseberg built it as an art project that can run real large language models on your computer - MacWinLin - [link]
00:21:23 Google I/O announced some pretty spectacular tools for creatives. Whos looking to take the plunge into Gemini with tools like Imagen, Veo and Flow? - [link]
00:30:47 Trying to stream to Zoom Events over RTMPS. vMix connects immediately but Vidiu Go doesnt. Vidiu connects to YouTube RTMP no issue. Same 1080p 30 streaming to both. Whats the issue?
00:32:23 It rarely happens, but sometimes I get a garbled video output from one of the HDMI outputs on my ATEM Extreme that feeds a Roland UVC-02 encoder. Only solution is a power cycle. Anyone else experience this?
00:35:53 I have the paid mix effect pro, with companion/streamdeck. Can get all working with MEP on an iPad, but wanting to just have all on a Mac. MEP will work w/Mac to atem , but cannot get streamdeck to work w/companion, even if says MEP is online.
00:38:36 The pretty new Uperfect Delta Mega 23.8‚Äù dual screen has some nice features, but does it support 25/30/50/60 FPS direct out from an ATEM Constellation. [link]
00:40:51 Hello, i would like to know how to control presets with novastar H series by using streamdeck
Thank you
00:41:57 Alex, recently you mentioned a base Mac mini handling up to 16 1080p outs ? Would this be raw 3g outputs or compressed?
00:43:45 I recently get a lot of spam calls from abroad on my cell phone. I even got cought by taking one "undisclosed number" which cost me like 80 bucks. Anything I can do about it other than not answering callers, I don¬¥t know?
00:48:51 LAWO‚Äôs latest software update for the mc¬≤ consoles now supports OSC. Why has it taken so long for major audio companies to add show control to their gear and how does OSC functionality influence your choice in equipment?
00:50:08 What are your favorite tie-down accessories and tips for cable management for an in-studio A/V rack?
00:53:49 What do you look for in a streaming solution? Is it convenience? customization? or the ability to provide both live and on-demand viewing?
00:55:36 Now that things have settled down more how do you feel about what happened with Josh Freese? Could things between these titans been handled differently? What does it say about the music industry today and how it is run? Danke 

01:00:01 If your cameras output 29.97fps but everything else in your pipeline like YouTube streaming and Zoom use whole frame rates like 30, is there any advantage with changing the ATEM settings to 30? Does that .03 difference matter?
01:02:28 What large media company have you seen pivot and succeed? The LA Times may need to make a huge pivot. - [link]

snippet.title: The Rundown (Episode 32)
snippet.description:
Technology is not just transforming the world‚Äîit‚Äôs redefining what it means to live, connect, and create in the digital age. The rapid acceleration of technological change presents both profound challenges and new opportunities, fundamentally altering how we relate to each other and understand ourselves.

On The Rundown Show, we dive deep into the forces reshaping our world, exploring not just the 'what' but the 'why' behind the latest trends. Each week, we offer a thoughtful, philosophical lens on how technology is influencing human connection, society, and the ways we experience life itself. Join us as we unpack and critically examine the technologies shaping our future, helping you navigate this evolving landscape with deeper insight and understanding.

snippet.title: Office Hours | Thursday | May 22, 2025
snippet.description:
We are here every day to answer your questions about media and production!

Submit your questions anytime https://www.askofficehours.global
Join our global community https://officehours.global

Markers are currently valid with countdown in place...

00:00:00 Intro
00:04:29 Show start
00:04:42 Can you explain the best way to segment Dante traffic on a managed network to avoid interference with other production traffic?
00:07:38 Can we take a moment to acknowledge members of our community for taking home Emmy's for "Outstanding Graphic Design ‚Äì Event/Show" ? [link]
00:09:28 For the Mac users on the panel - what are some of your favorite system monitors that can live in the menu bar? And what are the equivelent for our Windows brethren?
00:13:07 How do you avoid feedback issues when combining in-room sound reinforcement with live-streamed audio from a zoom panel participant?
00:18:39 When you pack up and move your gear from one location to another, how do you make it easy to re-assemble everything?
00:22:03 What are your thoughts on the Panasonic UE-160 vs anything else comparable? [link]
00:29:29 My Satechi stand/hub has limitations & the headphone jack never worked. Would the OWC Thunderbolt 5 Dock be a good replacement even though it doesn't have the same form factor as my Mac m1 mini which is what I liked most about the Satechi?
00:33:10 What platform or services are recommended for selling access to VOD content? 
VOD‚Äôs will be professional content from industry experts. 
Solution must handle sales and distribution of the content.
00:36:29 I tried to join the Panel this morning. My audio failed me. There is something wrong in my chain and I‚Äôm not sure what to do the audio change has issue. Do I need to update or stay where I am until the problem can be resolved.?
00:43:14 Is the DJI Pocket Osmo 3 a serious documentary film making tool? It's tiny. It actually has a ‚ÄúPRO mode‚Äù swiping left on the LCD screen and tapping ‚ÄúPRO‚Äù activates it.
00:47:42 What does the panel think about bonding vs. load balancing? Looking to provide failover for a live streaming. Interested in any specific policies employed for load balancing.
00:51:57 We are curious how everyone keeps track of project notes, docs on each project? Custom software? Would panelists be willing to share their start to finish workflow and tips with working with a client in regards to keeping organized?
00:55:11 When editing a project, how often do you run media backups during a slow month and how often during a busy week? Do you increase the frequency as you near a deadline?
00:58:23 Does Guy Cochran have any regrets about getting the LG quad monitor and how does he use it?
01:00:49 Reset zoom H5 audio - now working - what to do going forward?

Discover the troubleshooting nightmares and time-consuming headaches this equipment can cause. Is the Scarlett more trouble than it's worth? snippet.title: Office Hours | Wednesday | May 21, 2025
snippet.description:
We are here every day to answer your questions about media and production!

Submit your questions anytime https://www.askofficehours.global
Join our global community https://officehours.global

Markers are currently valid with countdown in place...

00:00:00 Intro
00:04:35 Show start
00:04:41 Morning Everyone! What does the Panel think of the newly released elgato streamdeck?
00:12:23 Roland just announced a new customizable control app, Venuset, for their switchers. Includes PTZ controls and record controls. Currently only iPad, but Mac and Windows in Q3. Great idea? [link]
00:14:02 What is "pink noise" used for in a AV environment like a H.O.W.?
00:15:59 What is the panel opinion on CapCut app for the Mac? [link]
00:17:37 I've seen guitarists like Ola Englund (founder of Solar Guitars), "The Haunted" etc, use Logic with a click track to program MIDI patch changes for his guitar pedals. How do you know what MIDI message to send? Capture it via a MIDI monitor? RTFM? Both?
00:18:53 What causes this glitch in the video? This is from the F1 streaming app. notice that the graphics aren't effected. since the broadcast is cut and graphics are added in the UK, is this just a transmission buffer error? [link]
00:24:00 Having some midi show control issues with QLab and the ETC EOS Family of consoles. This is the first time I have ever seen any issues with that. Anyone have any pointers for trouble shooting. QLab 5
00:25:27 Buyer's remorse after 2 weeks with the Yamaha DM3-D‚Äînow the Allen & Heath Qu-5D drops and blows away the competition! Should I trade up for the newer, shinier model?
00:27:08 How do you use the voice over tool with record and monitoring in the newly released Black Magic Davinci Resolve?
00:31:39 My local ABC affiliate (OTA reception) sounds like the speakers are out of phase. Is there anything that I can do?
00:34:19 I have come across two types of audio engineer - one who wants amps at full and those who optimise pre-gain, place channel faders at unity and masters close to -10 to unity THEN amps raised to suit the level required in the venue. What is correct?
00:39:50 We have networked 12 Panasonic 12K projectors. It was a little challenging. How would you do it better? Why and how would you do this, and how would you get it to work with LED walls and other large monitors and TVs around the rooms?
00:40:57 Thoughts on the new EHX Oceans Abyss reverb effects unit. Trailing reverb for each patch apparently. Thoughts?
[link]
00:41:27 What does the panel think of the next-generation Allen & Heath Qu range? I'm very impressed with the redesigned UI, integrated Dante, and the gain/feedback assistants. ([link])
00:42:59 What should podcasters use instead of CapCut?
00:47:36 I have been asked to help a community hockey area add some hockey game audio to the concession area. Do you think a shotgun mic would work for this or would you recommend a parabolic setup? Thinking I can mount it around 50-100‚Äô from the ice.
00:51:05 Do you think this could come in handy at events like NAB or InfoComm? 2900 bucks - G1T4-M1N1 droid. [link]
00:54:44 Any opinions on this Line Array, that has motorized hozizontal and vertical directivity steering? [link]
00:55:27 Frustrated with the audio mix on the Sirius XM Version of NBC broadcasts. Nats and Music overpower the announce track. Would this "audio summing issue" lie on the contribution side or the XM ingest? Would like to communicate with a solution.
00:56:39 What can we learn from Bill Owen‚Äôs retirement and how will this affect media production and its culture? How will the pending sale to Larry Ellison affect media and the production landscape?
00:58:03 Does a cable with 3.5 to 3.5 male differ from a cable with one end with 3.5 to 1/4 quarter inch male cable? Using for headphones monitoring.
01:01:38 Good morning. Ambient recording soon. Rode video mic NTG to a 32 bit float Tentacle Track E. Ramp the mic gain to 16 or go low? High pass filter to 150Hz?

snippet.title: Behind the Scenes of Drexel‚Äôs Unreal LED Wall for Filmmakers
snippet.description:
Office Hours longtime friend Nick Jushchyshyn and his students at Drexel University unveil their cutting-edge LED volume wall on May 15th show. This wall is designed not just for immersive filmmaking but with the cinematographer in mind. Built around a 20x10 ft AOTO LED display with an ultra-fine 1.5mm pixel pitch, this wall delivers rich blacks and seamless visuals thanks to light-absorbing casings and ultra-low moir√© behavior.

Every panel is genlocked to an Evertz 5601 system, ensuring frame-perfect sync between LED refresh and shutter timing‚Äîessential for avoiding ghosting or temporal drift. The wall's backbone is powered by Brompton's SX40 processor, distributing UHD video across 72 modular panels via 5x 20-amp 120V circuits.

And for you camera aficionados: motion tracking is achieved through a Vicon mocap system sampling at 120fps, with real-time camera tracking data streamed over a dedicated 10GbE network to the Unreal Engine render box. The studio‚Äôs ‚ÄúSputnik‚Äù crown rig‚Äîa DIY constellation of reflective markers mounted on zinc bolts‚Äîsits atop the dolly cam for spatial awareness, while scene calibration is perfected using false color imaging and light meters.

#VirtualProduction #LEDWall #Cinematography #UnrealEngine #MoCap #Genlock #VideoProduction #DrexelUniversity #NDIWorkflow #BromptonSX40

From the May 15, 2025 episode: https://youtube.com/live/nnC39wwNEcA?feature=share

snippet.title: UberSoftLightKit_02
snippet.description: 2 of 2 Instructional videos covering the parameters and controls of the Uber Soft Light Kit.  This video delves in the controls of the "Uber Soft Distant" and "Uber Soft Point" lights in the kit.  These lights allow for pseudo area lights via light wrapping controls as well as advanced falloff controls via custom light shaders for DAZ Studio.

snippet.title: The first Bluetooth editing controller - A quick review of TourBox Elite
snippet.description:
Back the Kickstarter: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/toutbox/tourbox-elite-the-ultimate-bluetooth-controller-for-creators
The Tourbox Elite is an unparalleled Bluetooth editing controller, engineered for digital content producers. I created my own custom preset specifically for Blender, and then put it to the test. Controls were easy to adjust, and working wirelessly is such a joy!
The kickstarter campaign ends December 24th 2021. There are serious savings to be had by grabbing the Tourbox before it gets officially released next year.

snippet.title: What is the fastest way to animate in Blender?
snippet.description:
In this video I'm proposing my solution to this problem: What is the fastest way to animate any object in all three dimensions in Blender?

Link to Procedural Trail Simulation tutorial here: https://youtu.be/KrCdv9sit_o
(Affiliate) link to buy the Botaniq addon here: https://www.blendermarket.com/products/botaniq-trees?ref=1129

This is the third video I'm making about real-time animation workflows in Blender, you can check out the two other videos here:
Real-time camera animation: https://youtu.be/a7qyW1G350g
Real-time object animation: https://youtu.be/eoSRMxMDYsk

Thanks for watching!

snippet.title: Tutorial: Making a Procedural Trail Simulation in Blender 4.4
snippet.description:
In this Blender tutorial, we'll be making a procedural trail effect using Geometry Nodes in Blender 4.4! We'll be animating an object using our mouse cursor and capturing the movement in real-time using auto-keying!

Link to the project file here: https://www.patreon.com/posts/128112747

Here's the tutorial from Blender Path that was a big inspiration (highly recommended watch!): https://youtu.be/Ir1qGy5ycdA

snippet.title: Audio-reactive Voice Animations #audiovisualizer #b3d
snippet.description:
The Audio Visualizer Masterclass is an in-depth course on making customizable audio-reactive animations in Blender!

Links are in the main video!

I've been working super hard on this for over 6 months now, and it's finally ready! I can‚Äôt wait to show you these powerful techniques for pre-rendered audio visualization in Blender! Here‚Äôs what you get with the course:

‚úÖ 17+ Hours of in-depth video lessons
‚úÖ 20 Blend files (including templates & completed projects)
‚úÖ 15 Audio files to practice with (6 custom tracks usable in your shared results!)
‚úÖ Powerful custom tools: Waveform Generator, MIDI-to-OBJ Converter and more!
‚úÖ Detailed 39-page Course Guide PDF
‚úÖ The Audio Visualizer Assistant:¬†A powerful, custom Blender Add-on developed specifically for this course to drastically speed up your workflow!

snippet.title: OptiTrack Stunt Mocap: Multi-Actor Capture Synced with Timecode | iClone 8
snippet.description:
Step into Studio 101 at Georgia State University‚Äôs CMII, where Actor Capture showcases multi-actor stunt motion capture using a 40-camera OptiTrack system. Captured in real-time and streamed into iClone 8 with Motion LIVE and Timecode Sync, this session demonstrates how complex stunt performances from multiple actors stay perfectly aligned for seamless post-production. Powered by Tentacle Sync and the Timecode Plugin, Actor Capture delivers high-precision mocap‚Äîtrusted by top studios and tailored to meet the demands of their clients' most ambitious projects.

Check out full story: https://magazine.reallusion.com/2025/05/16/actor-capture-syncs-stunt-and-performance-mocap-with-iclone-timecode/

snippet.title: Xsens + FaceGood Full Body Mocap Synced with Timecode | iClone 8

In this video, I compare 7 open-back headphones that stand out for mixing, music production, and everyday studio use. From budget-friendly options to higher-end picks, I walk you through models from Audio-Technica, Audeze, Sennheiser, Sony, Beyerdynamic, and HIFIMAN. One of them turned out to be a total steal, and another really surprised me in the best way. I also tested them with the Heritage Audio O.H.M. headphone amp to get the most out of each pair. If you're looking to upgrade your studio headphones or just curious about what open-back headphones can actually do for your sound, this guide will help you find the right fit for your setup and your budget. snippet.title: One-Click Robot Vision in After Effects, Adobe PAYS YOU, and a 3D Puppet-master | Motion Mondays
snippet.description:
A trendsetting new robot vision plugin for After Effects, Adobe invites you to be a paid apprentice, and digital puppetry goes hard with real-time. Check out the corresponding blog post here: https://www.schoolofmotion.com/blog/motion-mondays-may-19-2025

IMPORTANT: Our All Access program just launched with over 1,300 members - find out why it's the best way to level up your motion design skills.: https://schoolofmotion.com/all-access

This week, Substance 3D creator Sebastian De Guy launches Sans String Studio, bringing mind-blowing real-time puppetry to life with Ryan Corniel's innovative techniques! We've also got the scoop on Adobe's new Creative Apprenticeship program where you can literally get PAID to learn and build your portfolio. 

Tech news abounds with Tracery, a game-changing After Effects plugin for creating futuristic HUD overlays in seconds, and Airbnb's surprising invention of an entirely new animation format called LAVA! 

Plus, we're exploring Google's Material Design 3 motion guidelines, Envato's inspiration-generating tool, and highlighting incredible work from international artists that will blow your creative mind. Don't miss details on upcoming events like Camp MoGraph and Motion Plus NYC featuring Andrew Kramer himself!

snippet.title: Sarah Beth Morgan Gets Real About Parenthood, Career Crisis & Her New Podcast
snippet.description:
Sarah Beth Morgan, illustrator and School of Motion instructor, joins Joey to dish about the real stuff: moving across the country, having a baby, and navigating the ever-changing animation industry.  See the corresponding blog post here: https://www.schoolofmotion.com/blog/sarah-beth-morgan

Since her last appearance on the SOM¬†Podcast, she's moved across the country, had a baby (a delightful two-year-old egg enthusiast named Arty), and launched a narrative podcast called Ghost Frame while navigating what she describes as a "career crisis" in today's evolving animation landscape.In this conversation with Joey, Sarah Beth opens up about how parenthood has surprisingly benefited her creative work, her experiments with murals and local art, taking social media breaks, and her thoughts on the current "malaise" affecting the 2D animation industry. 

--

Check out Sarah Beth's SOM course, Illustration for Motion https://www.schoolofmotion.com/courses/illustration-for-motion
In Illustration for Motion you'll learn the foundations of modern illustration from Sarah Beth Morgan. You‚Äôll discover a range of illustrative styles through mock client briefs meant to mimic jobs found in the real world. By the end of the course, you'll be equipped to create incredible illustrated works of art that you can use in your animation projects right away.

snippet.title: NexLink Wireless Pairing
snippet.description:
NexLink is Sound Devices' proprietary long-distance protocol for remote-controlling wireless transmitters. By pairing transmitters to an Astral receiver, you are able to change all settings from the receiver without touching the transmitter itself. Now, this initial pairing sequence can also be performed wirelessly!

To learn more about NexLink, visit this article: https://www.sounddevices.com/nexlink-explained/

To learn about the A20-HH mic visit: https://www.sounddevices.com/product/a20-hh/

snippet.title: Transmitter Control Handoff
snippet.description:
NexLink is Sound Devices' proprietary long-distance protocol for remote-controlling wireless transmitters. With the Handoff feature, NexLink control of your transmitters can be passed from one receiver to another!

To learn more about NexLink, visit this article: https://www.sounddevices.com/nexlink-explained/

To learn about the A20-HH mic visit: https://www.sounddevices.com/product/a20-hh/

snippet.title: A CGI 3D Short Film: "Claw" - by ESMA | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "Claw" - by ESMA  - Andrew, a young cinephile, watches a horror film from the 80s that he criticizes incessantly. The film's iconic killer becomes mysteriously aware of Andrew's incessant comments. He crosses the screen between them and throws Andrew inside, challenging him to outdo him in killing the remaining victims. Andrew, now a prisoner of the film, is convinced he can easily meet the challenge. But can he really outdo the killer?

snippet.title: CGI & VFX Breakdowns: "Shahid MBC" - by Squids VFX | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
Check out this revealing VFX Breakdown "Shahid MBC" from the talented Squids VFX! - For this high-impact TV commercial, our team handled the full CGI and visual effects production. Shot entirely on a green screen, the live-action footage served as the foundation for a visually rich world that we built from the ground up. Our artists crafted immersive environments, dynamic effects, and seamless compositing to integrate the talent into the digitally created scenes. The result is a cinematic spot where reality and imagination blend flawlessly, enhancing the brand message with breathtaking visuals that elevate the storytelling without overshadowing it.

TEAM:
Squids VFX: Omar Naguib, Youssef Mahmoud, Remon Raafat
Head of Production: Omar Abdelrazek
Line Producers: Mariam Soliman, Mai Tolba
Compositing Supervisor: Mohamed Ezzat
Lead Compositors: AbdelRahman Kamel, Ahmed El Gendy
Senior Compositors: Mohy Eldin Jamal, Remon Salah
Compositors: Moheb Ayman, Ahmed Samir, Michel Maged, Mahmoud Hassan, Ahmed Ashraf, Mahmoud Hammoud, Kareem Elhawary.
Senior Motion Graphic: Muhamed Nasser
3D Dep. Supervisor / Art Director: Osama Ahmed Aly
CG Supervisor: Magdy Mohsen
Senoir 3D Modelling / Texture Artist: Ahmed Magdy
Senior Look Dev. Artist: Nour Nagy
Senior Character Artist: Nourhan Ghorab
Grooming Artist: Mariam El-Kassifi
Senior Animator: Peter Samir
Animator / Rigger: Aya Khalifa
Senior Environment Artist: AbduAllah Ahmed
Environment Artists: Sammar Aboulrous, Mohamed Salah
Senior FX Artist: Mina Vaseily
FX Artists: Kareem Yasser, Ahmed Abdelghany
Senior Matchmove artist: Nasr Mohy Eldin
Matte-Painting Artist: Ticeer Shahin
Graphic Designer: Ghada Medhat Maghraby
Senior VFX Editor: Moataz Ahmed
VFX Editors: Mina Medhat, Omar El Mahdy, 
Social Media: Kareem Salah
IT Department: Alaa Naguib, William Yousry, Mohamed Ali Khalil
Financial Manager: Younan Monir
Accountant: Emil Ashraf, Bishoy Samir
Legal Counsel: Fady Seif
Financial Consulting & Audit: Alaa El Essawi, Hani Mazloum Zekri, Ahmed Mohamed El Roubi
Office Aide: Galal Rabea, Abdel Rady Shamy, Mohamed Al Rawy, Mohamed El Saeedy, Walid Nageh, Gomaa Shawky.

Software Used: 3ds Max; After Effects; Houdini; Maya; Nuke; Unreal; Vray; ZBrush

snippet.title: A CGI Short Film Trailer: "BABIRU " - by Second Tomorrow Studios | TheCGBros
snippet.description:
TheCGBros Presents "BABIRU" Trailer by  Second Tomorrow Studios - What happens when humanity is gone, but its machines live on?  In the rusted remains of a fallen megacity, AIs continue to operate on the final programming left behind by their long-dead creators. But when two delivery AIs stumble upon a lost artifact from the past, they trigger a war that could change the future of BABIRU forever.

Directed by Nguyen-Anh Nguyen (Hyperlight, Akira Project) and written by Philip Gelatt (Love, Death + Robots, Secret Level), BABIRU is an original proof of concept for a feature film created entirely in Unreal Engine. Funded by an Epic Megagrant, this film redefines the possibilities of animation filmmaking.

Built entirely in Unreal Engine 5 and completed with Blackmagic Design Fusion & Resolve for color, VFX, and finishing, BABIRU demonstrates how cutting-edge tools can revolutionize storytelling. Funded by an Epic Games Megagrant, this project was made possible with the support of an incredible team and key industry partners‚Äîincluding CineGround Media, Mathematic Studio, Beyond Capture Studios, KitBash3D, Perforce Software, and Blackmagic Design‚Äîwho helped bring this world to life.

‚ö°Ô∏è Learn how this was made at: 
https://shorturl.at/xtXnO

EPIC GAMES
Executive Producers: Allistair Thompson Shawn Dunn  
 
Music: Music: Survive - Eric Wiesler, Daniel Stanczykiewicz - Lukacino Publishing, Pashalina Publishing Company // Metal Beast - Luke William Standridge - Ninja Tracks Music // Vacuum - Eric Wiesler, Daniel Stanczykiewicz - Lukacino Publishing, Pashalina Publishing Company 

¬© 2025 Second Tomorrow Studios

#BABIRUFilm #SciFiAnimation #MadeInUnreal #Cyberpunk #EpicMegagrant #FutureOfFilm

snippet.title: Spotlighting Black Women Photographers | BWP √ó Flickr Grant Celebration
snippet.description:
On May 8th, I was joined by Genesis Falls for a powerful livestream featuring the work and impact of Black Women Photographers (BWP) ‚Äî a global community founded by Polly Irungu, championing over 2,100 Black and African women creatives. 

https://blackwomenphotographers.com

Since 2020, BWP has been breaking barriers, offering grants, education, and exposure to photographers who deserve the spotlight.

Big thanks to our partners at SmugMug and Flickr, who share a passion for elevating creativity and storytelling across the globe!

‚ú® What‚Äôs on deck:

- The story behind this year's theme: The Spaces We Occupy
- Behind-the-scenes look at the judging process and grant prizes
- Featuring 10 standout runner-up photos
- Announcing the $5,000 grant winner LIVE! üéâ

You‚Äôll meet amazing photographers, get inspired, and find out how to follow and support their work beyond today‚Äôs broadcast.

üëâ Hit that Follow button and join us on Flickr, SmugMug, and TWiP for more inspiring events like this!

snippet.title: Matthew Jordan Smith: The Power of Personal Projects, Persistence, and Print
snippet.description:
In this episode, I sit down with my good friend Matthew Jordan Smith ‚Äî celebrity photographer, author of Aretha Cool, and master storyteller ‚Äî to dive into the powerful connection between personal projects, photography's future, and staying true to your vision in an AI-driven world.

You will discover:

- How Matthew turned a promise to Aretha Franklin into a celebrated book
- The impact of AI on the authenticity of photography
- Why printed photos and physical books matter more than ever
- How to stay creatively inspired, even without a big city around you
- Advice for photographers balancing art, career, and personal fulfillment

This conversation is a masterclass on passion, perseverance, and finding your voice as a creative. Drop your thoughts in the comments ‚Äî and if you enjoyed it, don't forget to subscribe, like, and share with a friend! 

You can learn more about Matthew at thisweekinphoto.com.

snippet.title: Genesis Falls on Film Photography, Authenticity and Representation
snippet.description:
In this episode, I sit down with the talented Genesis Falls to explore her fascinating journey through the world of photography. We dive deep into Genesis's recent accolades, including her prestigious recognition through the Flickr and Black Women Photographers Grant Award, and discuss how community support has been crucial for women of color in the industry.

Genesis shares her refreshingly intentional approach to film photography, explaining the technical constraints that shape her creative process and the unique workflow differences between analog and digital. We go behind the scenes of her award-winning project "Children at Play," where she reveals her methods for capturing those authentic, unscripted moments that define her work.

The conversation takes practical turns as we discuss the commitment required for film processing, the importance of celebrating fellow artists' successes, and Genesis's forthcoming projects focusing on artists of color. She offers valuable insights for emerging photographers that cut through the typical advice noise.

Join us for this honest, technically-rich conversation about visual storytelling, representation in photography, and the distinctive emotional connection that comes with shooting on film. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this episode delivers both inspiration and practical takeaways for photographers at any level.

Genesis' Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/geno_tatted

---

Applications will close on April 14, 2025. Please apply and spread the word before the deadline!

https://blackwomenphotographers.com/smugmug-flickr

This grant is open to Black women and non-binary photographers who are members ‚Äì new and old ‚Äì  of Black Women Photographers and Flickr. 

The grant recipient will be selected by BWP founder Polly Irungu, previous grant winner, and BWP member Genesis Falls, Flickr Community‚Äôs MacKenzie Joslin, and This Week in Photo‚Äôs Frederick Van Johnson. 

Chapters

00:00 Catching Up: Life Updates and Travel Thoughts
03:00 Travel Experiences: Perspectives on Different Cultures
06:02 Childhood Memories: Growing Up with Roaches
08:55 Life as a Game: Cheat Codes and Success
12:02 Photography Talk: Film vs. Digital
14:59 The Blackwell Photographers Group: Understanding the Community
18:04 Future Projects: What's Next for Genesis Falls
22:13 Genesis Falls: Journey to Recognition
29:52 Empowering Communities: The Role of Black Women Photographers
33:43 The Art of Film Photography: Intentionality and Process
48:53 Children at Play: Capturing Moments and Stories
53:07 The Commitment of Film Processing
55:11 The Joy of Recognition in Photography
57:17 Photography as a Bookmark of Memories
01:00:04 Advice for Aspiring Photographers
01:01:47 Upcoming Projects and Artistic Exploration

snippet.title: From Fish to Fords: The Photographer Who Risks EVERYTHING
snippet.description:
Ever wonder what happens when adventure photography meets automotive documentation? Devan Ence shoots both fly fishing and classic Fords, and his approach to risk vs reward might surprise you. 

From submerged cameras to slammed Broncos ‚Äî buckle up! This episode covers it all.

üéØ QUICK LINKS:

00:00 - Intro and background
02:00 - From fishing to photography
05:00 - Documentary approach to water photography
09:00 - Camera gear survival stories
14:00 - Conservation projects
19:00 - Automotive photography techniques
22:00 - The Bronco build project
26:00 - Balancing different photography niches
29:00 - Upcoming projects and magazine work

üîß GEAR MENTIONED:

‚Ä¢ Camera bodies (multiple, some now sleeping with the fishes)
‚Ä¢ Wide angle lenses for automotive work
‚Ä¢ Underwater protection systems

snippet.description:
Here‚Äôs another clip from my interview with wedding photographer Troy Miller.  He shares a story about a totally random encounter he had at Yosemite - one that basically rewired his career trajectory.

 He even made a metal sign of the quote‚Ä¶ because‚Ä¶ Troy. üõ†Ô∏è

The whole discussion is up at thisweekinphoto.com if you want to check it out. We cover his usual stuff about creativity and whatnot, but also dig into why he thinks we all need to slow down (rich coming from a guy who makes metal signs of quotes, but he makes some solid points)!

Check it out at thisweekinphoto.com. Worth a listen while you're pretending to work.

snippet.title: REVEALED: The Most Popular Camera of 2024 (It's Not What You Think!)
snippet.description:
This week I'm joined by renowned commercial photographer Rob Grimm. We break down Flickr's surprising 2024 photography trends. 

We explore shocking statistics, including why 900 people still use the iPhone 3G, how Canon dominated the top camera spots, and the unexpected 30% boom in street photography. 

Plus, discover Flickr's most active photography communities, and why September 30th became 2024's biggest upload day! This discussion is great for photographers, tech enthusiasts, and creative professionals looking to understand the current state of photography.

Flickr blog:  https://flickr.com/year-in-review/2024/?utm_campaign=year-in-review-2024&utm_source=flickr&utm_medium=website&utm_content=twip

Podcast: http://www.thisweekinphoto.com

snippet.title: I Was a Storyteller: Troy Miller on Photography's Future and Finding New Creative Paths
snippet.description:
In this eye-openinig conversation, veteran photographer Troy Miller opens up about his journey through 30 years in professional photography and his recent exploration of AI music creation. Troy shares the story behind his powerful song "I Was a Storyteller," which captures the complex emotions of watching your industry transform around you.

We dive deep into Troy's experience with Suno AI for music creation, discussing how artificial intelligence is becoming another creative tool, much like the transition from film to digital photography. Troy explains how he combined his own lyrics with AI technology to express feelings that many creative professionals might find familiar in today's rapidly changing landscape.

The conversation expands beyond just photography and music, touching on the future of creative industries, the impact of technological change, and how professionals can adapt while maintaining their artistic integrity. Troy shares invaluable insights from his decades of experience, offering a unique perspective on everything from wedding photography to embracing new forms of creativity.

Whether you're a photographer, creative professional, or simply interested in how AI is reshaping artistic expression, this interview provides an honest look at the challenges and opportunities facing creative industries today.

localized.title: I Was a Storyteller: Troy Miller on Photography's Future and Finding New Creative Paths
localized.description:
In this eye-openinig conversation, veteran photographer Troy Miller opens up about his journey through 30 years in professional photography and his recent exploration of AI music creation. Troy shares the story behind his powerful song "I Was a Storyteller," which captures the complex emotions of watching your industry transform around you.

We dive deep into Troy's experience with Suno AI for music creation, discussing how artificial intelligence is becoming another creative tool, much like the transition from film to digital photography. Troy explains how he combined his own lyrics with AI technology to express feelings that many creative professionals might find familiar in today's rapidly changing landscape.

The conversation expands beyond just photography and music, touching on the future of creative industries, the impact of technological change, and how professionals can adapt while maintaining their artistic integrity. Troy shares invaluable insights from his decades of experience, offering a unique perspective on everything from wedding photography to embracing new forms of creativity.

Whether you're a photographer, creative professional, or simply interested in how AI is reshaping artistic expression, this interview provides an honest look at the challenges and opportunities facing creative industries today.

And now, we bring all that rhythmic cacophony to you in typographic resonance‚Äîa virtual conference featuring Latin American typographic excellence and insight.

The Cha Che Chi conference was held online on March 3rd and 4th, as a two-day showcase of presentations and panels on what‚Äôs happening in Latin American typography today.

snippet.title: Not Typecast: Two Women and their Typography at Mid-Century
snippet.description:
Briar Levit and Anne Galperin tell the stories of Ellen Raskin and Betti Broadwater Haft, two New York-based contemporaries: one an illustrator turned book designer, turned author and the other, a multidisciplinary designer who was one of the rare women to design a typeface for Photo-lettering Inc. These are just two of the many histories featured in the forthcoming book of essays, ‚ÄúBaseline Shift: Untold Stories of Women in Graphic Design History.‚Äù

- - - - 

About the Speakers

BRIAR LEVIT is an Associate Professor of Graphic Design at Portland State University. She studied at San Francisco State University for her undergraduate degree in graphic design and at Central Saint Martins in London for her MA in Communication Design. Levit spent her early career in publishing as Art Director of Bitch: Feminist Response to Pop Culture magazine as well as an independent book designer. Her self-initiated publications are walking books that challenge the existing hiking guide genre. More recently, Levit‚Äôs feature-length documentary, Graphic Means: A History of Graphic Design Production (2017) which follows design production from manual to digital methods, established an obsession with design history‚Äîparticularly aspects not in the canon. She currently co-directs The People‚Äôs Graphic Design Archive with Louise Sandhaus and Brockett Horne and has edited a book of essays debuting October 26th, 2021 entitled ‚ÄúBaseline Shift: Previously Untold Stories of Women Throughout Graphic Design History.‚Äù

ANNE GALPERIN is an Associate Professor of Art, and Graphic Design program director at the State University of New York at New Paltz. She earned a BSc in Human Development and Social Policy from Northwestern University, and an MFA in 2D Design from Cranbrook Academy of Art. Before entering academia, Galperin edited and wrote for the Macmillan Publishing Company, was a freelance writer and researcher, and designed books in-house at Chronicle Books. Her body of work includes book design for alt-press, museum, and art book clients, including Four Walls Eight Windows/OR Books, the Walker Art Center, and Distributed Art Publishers. Her essay about American Designer Betti Broadwater Haft is included in ‚ÄúBaseline Shift: Untold Stories of Women in Graphic Design History‚Äù, edited by Briar Levit and to be released in late October 2021

snippet.description:
Virtual Event
Wednesday, January 19, 2022

Meet the third group of 25TDC Typeface Design judges. Moderated by Ksenya Samarskaya, Committee Co-Chair.

At this event, the judges for the LGC (Latin, Greek, Cyrillic) categories discuss their work, the state of communication design and typography today, and what they‚Äôll be looking for when selecting the best typeface design in the world.

    Kostas Bartsokas
    Martin Majoor
    Daria Petrova
    Ulrike Rausch
    Kara Gordon

Please watch previous sessions (labelled "Global Judges Day" to hear from the judges for CJK (Chinese, Japanese, Korean), Indic, and Arabic scripts. (A total of four sessions for this year's competition.) 

You can also meet the judges the Communication Design competition in "Meet the Judges II".

snippet.title: Towards a Global Definition of Excellence in Type Design - Part 3: Arabic
snippet.description:
Meet some of the 25TDC Typeface Design Jury moderated by Nadine Chahine, Committee Co-Chair.

This is part 3 of a three part series. 

This year marks the expansion of TDC‚Äôs Typeface Design Competition with 3 extra categories added for Arabic, Indic, and CJK (Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) scripts. While TDC has long accepted entries in these categories, 2021 marks the first year with multiple dedicated judges for these categories. Each of these categories has 3 judges known for their expertise in that field.

In this video our inaugural judges discuss how one can define excellence in type design in each of these 3 categories, if there is anything there that is unique to that script‚Äôs historical printing and typographic history, and to discuss the general state of type design at this point in time.

If you are interested in submitting an original typeface design please visit: 
https://tdc.oneclub.org

snippet.title: ‚ÄúPerson Place Thing‚Äù with Bobby Martin Jr.
snippet.description:
Virtual Event 
09.20.2021

Bobby C. Martin Jr. is co-founder of Champions Design, a branding and design agency headquartered in New York City.

He sets the relentless standard of design and vision for the agency he founded, with Jennifer Kinon, in 2010. Together they have partnered with a wide range of clients such as Amazon, Apple, Dartmouth College, Girl Scouts, MTV, the National Basketball Association and The Studio Museum in Harlem.

Martin recently illustrated his first children‚Äôs book ‚ÄúHave I Ever Told You Black Lives Matter‚Äù (Tilbury House). In 2020, he was featured in the renowned design publication, Eye Magazine‚Äôs iconic 100th issue.

He has lectured about brand identity around the world, sat on numerous awards juries, and has been a special guest on Design Matters, Design Observer and NPR‚Äôs Studio 360. Martin served as a board member of AIGA/NY from 2006-08, and the board of the Type Directors Club from 2014-2021. In 2019, Champions Design was named one of the 30 Most Important Companies in Design by Fast Company. Bobby Martin has won numerous international awards from the AIGA, Art Directors Club, Communication Arts, D&AD, and the TDC, among others. He is a graduate of Virginia Commonwealth University, and earned an MFA from the School of Visual Arts where he currently serves on the faculty.

Randy Cohen‚Äôs first professional work was writing humor pieces, essays, and stories for newspapers and magazines (The New Yorker, Harpers, the Atlantic, Young Love Comics). His first television work was writing for ‚ÄúLate Night With David Letterman‚Äù for which he won three Emmy awards. His fourth Emmy was for his work on Michael Moore‚Äôs ‚ÄúTV Nation.‚Äù He received a fifth Emmy as a result of a clerical error, and he kept it. For twelve years he wrote ‚ÄúThe Ethicist,‚Äù a weekly column for the New York Times Magazine. In 2010, his first play, ‚ÄúThe Punishing Blow,‚Äù ran at New York‚Äôs Clurman Theater. His most recent book, ‚ÄúBe Good: how to navigate the ethics of everything,‚Äù was published by Chronicle. He is currently the creator and host of Person Place Thing, a public radio program.

snippet.title: Playing with Words, Playing with Type ‚Äî Eric Widjaja
snippet.description:
Virtual Event
May 20, 2021

ERIC WIDJAJA founded Jakarta-based design studio Thinking*Room in 2005 after finding his love for graphic design in music and graduated from the Academy of Art University, San Francisco. His work in telling a story with a clear voice and lasting characters through design, from working for brands to self-initiated projects, is established across the country and internationally.

RITTER WILLY PUTRA is an Art Director at Thinking*Room since 2017 with broad expertise from designing for brand identity, installations to publications. He embraces story in design from the largest to the minuscule detail. His notable projects go as diverse as developing sculpture design for the Gelora Bung Karno Stadium in Jakarta to designing for Indonesian unicorn e-commerce, Bukalapak.

snippet.title: Typographics 2022: Book Report Footnoted with Lorraine Wild
snippet.description:
This talk took place on June 18, 2022 in The Great Hall at The Cooper Union as part of Typographics Conference. The livestreaming, recording and archiving of the event was made possible by the generous support of Google Fonts.

A look at three different books designed by Green Dragon Office (and published in the pandemic) that reflect this design office‚Äôs obsessions with history, genre and narrative structure.

Lorraine Wild is a graphic designer in Los Angeles. Her design firm, Green Dragon Office, focuses on collaborative work with artists, architects, curators, editors and publishers. In addition, she serves as the Creative Design Consultant to the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, consulting on publications, exhibitions, and design for public outreach. She is a member of the faculty of the California Institute of the Arts. Wild received the AIGA Gold Medal in 2006. Recent projects include the design of books and exhibition catalogues for the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Cranbrook Academy Art Museum, and the Kestner Gesellschaft in Hannover. She is a graduate of the Cranbrook Academy of Art and the Yale School of Art.

Home: greendragonoffice.com
Instagram: @wildlosangeles

Lorraine Wild is a graphic designer in Los Angeles. Her design firm, Green Dragon Office, focuses on collaborative work with artists, architects, curators, editors and publishers. In addition, she serves as the Creative Design Consultant to the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, consulting on publications, exhibitions, and design for public outreach. She is a member of the faculty of the California Institute of the Arts. Wild received the AIGA Gold Medal in 2006. Recent projects include the design of books and exhibition catalogues for the Los Angeles County Museum of Art, Cranbrook Academy Art Museum, and the Kestner Gesellschaft in Hannover. She is a graduate of the Cranbrook Academy of Art and the Yale School of Art.

Home: greendragonoffice.com
Instagram: @wildlosangeles

snippet.title: Typographics 2022: Graphic Design Is Easy with Yotam Hadar
snippet.description:
This talk took place on June 18, 2022 in The Great Hall at The Cooper Union as part of Typographics Conference. The livestreaming, recording and archiving of the event was made possible by the generous support of Google Fonts.

‚ÄúGraphic Design is Easy‚Äù is an attempt to articulate a design process that rejects overthinking and embraces obvious, lazy, and reductive ideas. It stems from the belief that there might be unique clarity in the first idea that comes to mind in a given situation. Situation=inspiration, Context=content.

Yotam Hadar is a graphic designer, typographer and educator, interested in the potential of subtle gestures to create meaning and impact. He spent the last 15 years collaborating with clients and studios like Nike, Apple, Prada, Movement Research, Pentagram, Project Projects, 2x4 and Sagmeister & Walsh to create work across print, branding, environmental and interactive design that won accolades from the ADC, TDC, Tokyo TDC, Chaumont Festival, Graphis, and Brand New Awards, among others. A design educator since 2009, Yotam taught design and typography at Yale School of Art, Pratt Institute, Parsons School of Design and Rutgers University, and was a guest critic at RISD, SVA and NYU.

Home: yotamhadar.com
Twitter: @Yotam
Instagram: @yotamh

localized.description: How can we do better research? ü§î This is the question Danielle Green answered on her inspiring and insightful Talk from UXLx 2024 "Scaling your Scrappy Research Process". üëè New Talk video now available in full at üëâ www.videos.ux-lx.com. Unmissable!

snippet.title: Scaling your Scrappy Research Process
snippet.description:
Speaker: Danielle Green

Like most aspects of product and development, research looks very different at startups compared to enterprise businesses. But how does the transition actually happen? How do you know when it is time to move from one research approach to another?

This presentation will address how to determine which research practices best fit your organization and what you need to do to level up your research when the time is right.

Learn how to anticipate these process changes and become an effective research powerhouse on the other side.

snippet.title: Design System Lies
snippet.description:
Speaker: Stephen Hay

Design systems come with promises. Sometimes, though, they don't deliver. Our assumptions and expectations about such systems are partly to blame. But there is hope! By recognising design systems for what they are, we can use them more effectively.

snippet.title: AI by Design
snippet.description:
Speaker: Dan Saffer

Most AI projects fail. Some fail quietly before launch; some fail spectacularly publicly, becoming another media horror story about AI. Why does this happen? Because the current process for designing AI products and services is broken, especially when it comes to product strategy‚Äîwhat projects to pursue. But a new approach to designing AI is possible, one that instills more cooperation between designers, PMs, data scientists, and engineers.

This talk walks through a new method that has been developed over many years at Carnegie Mellon University's Human-Computer Interaction Institute. This method uses elements of user-centered design and technology capabilities to find situations where moderate technical performance, high value, and low risk combine to make successful AI projects.

This talk looks specifically about not just how, but also where and when AI should be deployed‚Äîand why most companies are doing AI wrong.

snippet.title: Designing Better Closed Captions UX - WORDS 2023
snippet.description:
Vitaly Friedman, Creative Lead of Smashing Magazine and UX consultant for European Parliament, shares valuable insights into how captions and subtitles can enhance accessibility and improve the user experience for all. Learn about best practices for captioning guidelines, the differences between subtitles and captions, and the importance of considering environmental impact. You'll come away with a better understanding of how to make your content more accessible and user-friendly for everyone."

#ux #accessibility #uxwriting #uxdesign

snippet.title: Hawkeye VFX
snippet.description:
A key feature of our work on Marvel Studios‚Äô Hawkeye is the high-speed car chase where Hawkeye and his sidekick are pursued across the streets of Brooklyn, through a Christmas tree sales yard, and onto the Manhattan Bridge. Using a fully digital model of the bridge combined with matte paintings and CG set extensions, we transformed plates shot on location into the familiar skylines of New York. See the highlights on our VFX sizzle reel. 

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King VFX | Weta Digital
snippet.description:
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King is the epic conclusion to The Lord of Rings trilogy, and the result of almost a decade‚Äôs worth of creative and technological innovation. It encompasses ground-breaking technology and techniques. We used a multitude of sophisticated visual effects to create landscapes and creatures of unprecedented scale and complexity.
Our work on The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King won the Academy Award¬Æ for Best Visual Effects, and the BAFTA Award for Best Special Visual Effects.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.title: Jungle Cruise VFX | Weta Digital
snippet.description:
Weta Digital‚Äôs contribution to Disney‚Äôs Jungle Cruise focused primarily on creating environments‚Äîincluding hundreds of kilometres of CG Amazon River, with mist, waterfalls and rapids‚Äîas well as the creatures that populate the jungle. We created and hand-animated Frank‚Äôs ever-loyal, and fully CG, pet jaguar Proxima, and crafted motion vignettes for the abundance of birds, bugs and monkeys that call the jungle home.

localized.title: The Green Knight VFX | Weta Digital
localized.description:
Weta Digital‚Äôs contribution to The Green Knight focused on atmospheric landscapes and strange characters, including a race of mystical giants and a talking fox. Our team used matte painting and traditional compositing techniques to honour director David Lowry's surreal medieval vision.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.title: The Art of Virtual Production with Weta Digital
snippet.description:
Earlier in the year, our Executive Producer David Conley and two of our VFX Supervisors, Erik Winquist and Stephen Unterfranz, joined Shadow in the Cloud director Rosanne Liang on a panel for the DGA Virtual Production event. They had an open conversation about modern virtual production technology, including two projects with different LED workflows, and discussed in detail the learnings and challenges they experienced with some of our earlier LED virtual production projects.

Artists and Innovators in the World of Digital Entertainment.

snippet.title: How I Think Visually: My Sketched Mind in Action. Reflections on Exploring Visual PKM with Jerry.
snippet.description:
üöÄüìï Pre-order the book: https://sketch-your-mind.com/
‚úèÔ∏è Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/  üöÄ Cohort 14 is scheduled for the Summer of 2025 (dates are not yet finalized).
üßë üíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm

----

In this video, I reflect on a recent Zoom conversation with Jerry Michalski, creator of Jerry‚Äôs Brain, and walk you through how I use linked visual notes in Obsidian Excalidraw. We revisit key ideas from our discussion‚Äîincluding concept mapping, the Idea Atlas, and the power of modular illustrations‚Äîand I respond to Jerry‚Äôs follow-up insight: the aha moment when modifying a single visual element automatically updates every illustration that links to it.

You‚Äôll see, for example, how a small formatting change in an illustration about aligning habits with identity cascades across my vault, updating both my Book-on-a-Page for Atomic Habits and my Excalidraw Writing Machine video. This isn‚Äôt just a technical detail‚Äîit‚Äôs a different way of thinking about knowledge work.

I also share how the Visual Thinking Workshop has evolved‚Äîfrom small live cohorts to a full self-paced course with over 70 chapters, designed to support playful, visual-first thinking in Obsidian.

üß† Check out Jerry‚Äôs Brain: https://bra.in/6vAnza

---

00:27 About Jerry Michalski and Jerry's Brain

02:03 Introducing My Book: Sketch Your Mind

09:03 Jerry‚Äôs Feedback: Cascading Edits Across Visual Notes  
10:27 Paradigm Shift: Thinking with Linked Visual Elements  
12:00 The Power of Linked Icons in Excalidraw + Obsidian  
13:06 ExcaliBrain vs. TheBrain: Comparing Graph Views  
15:02 Visual Thinking in Practice: The Idea Atlas in Action  
17:29 Associations Graph: Tracing Icons Across Notes  
18:32 Chronos vs. Kairos: Visual Metaphors for Time  
21:46 From Productivity to Playfulness: A Reflective Insight  
22:15 Flipping the Note: How Text and Visuals Coexist  
24:00 Seeing vs. Writing: Different Modes of Association  
25:18 A Brain-Like Note System, Powered by Excalidraw  
26:32 Sketch Your Mind: Book, Course, and Cohort Offers  
27:43 Wrap-Up: Summary, Book Pre-Order, and Next Steps  

----

snippet.title: How I Published My Book for $0 Using Obsidian, Pandoc, Calibre (EPUB, PDF, Audiobook)
snippet.description:
üöÄüìï The best way to say "Thank You" is by pre-ordering Sketch Your Mind http://sketch-your-mind.com/
‚úèÔ∏è Check out the Visual Thinking Workshop https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/
üßë üíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm
üßë‚Äçüíª Access all the project files here https://gist.github.com/zsviczian/db6c41d3698b13ed78f8e4f226706113

----

In this video I'm diving into a workflow that's an absolute gold mine for self-publishers, or anyone wanting to create beautiful, professional PDFs, EPUBs, and text files from their Markdown notes. I'll be sharing why I chose Obsidian MD and Excalidraw to write my book, illustrating how these free tools, combined with a clever workflow compatible with Windows, Mac, and (likely) Linux, can generate stunning outputs. Discover how to leverage Obsidian and Excalidraw to self-publish your book or create professional documents effortlessly.

Check out the links in the video description for all the files and resources mentioned in this tutorial!

localized.description:
üöÄüìï The best way to say "Thank You" is by pre-ordering Sketch Your Mind http://sketch-your-mind.com/

----

In this video I'm diving into a workflow that's an absolute gold mine for self-publishers, or anyone wanting to create beautiful, professional PDFs, EPUBs, and text files from their Markdown notes. I'll be sharing why I chose Obsidian MD and Excalidraw to write my book, illustrating how these free tools, combined with a clever workflow compatible with Windows, Mac, and (likely) Linux, can generate stunning outputs. Discover how to leverage Obsidian and Excalidraw to self-publish your book or create professional documents effortlessly.

Check out the links in the video description for all the files and resources mentioned in this tutorial!

snippet.description:
üöÄüìï Book Launch site http://sketch-your-mind.com/

üßë üíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm

----

In this video I share how shifting from trains of thought to LEGO blocks has transformed the way I think about notes.
Instead of building rigid sequences, I focus on creating modular, reusable blocks that invite play and creativity. I walk you through the four visual constraints I use to make my notes tile well‚Äîso they‚Äôre easy to reuse, remix, and build with.

This idea is at the heart of Chapter 2 in my upcoming book Sketch Your Mind‚Äîpre-orders are open now. I also share details about Cohort 13 of the Visual Thinking Workshop, where we take a book apart like a LEGO set and rebuild it as a Book-on-a-Page.

Thanks for watching!

snippet.title: Zettels, AI, and a Book Even I Didn't See Coming
snippet.description:
üöÄüìï Book Launch site http://sketch-your-mind.com/
‚úèÔ∏è Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/  üöÄ Cohort 13 starts on 12 April 2024. We'll be reading Tiny Experiments by Anne-Laure Le Cunff
üßë üíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm

----

In this video, I share two key insights from the PKM Summit that fundamentally shifted how I think about Zettelkasten and AI.

üß† Zettelkasten isn‚Äôt about finding the perfect parent note‚Äîit‚Äôs about embracing imperfection, randomness, and your personal fingerprint. This simple shift helped me move from pools of notes to meaningful trains of thought.

ü§ñ With AI, the real risk isn‚Äôt just privacy‚Äîit‚Äôs giving up your agency. I reflect on how AI can support your process without taking over your thinking, and how to stay in the driver‚Äôs seat creatively.

This journey also led to something bigger: a book. I set out to write and self-publish *Sketch Your Mind* in just six weeks. After presenting it at the PKM Summit and refining it with amazing feedback, I‚Äôm thrilled to announce it‚Äôs now available for pre-order!

üöÄ Pre-order perks are available, and you‚Äôre invited to join the launch event.

üéì Also‚ÄîCohort 13 of the Visual Thinking Workshop is coming! We'll be reading *Tiny Experiments* by Anne-Laure Le Cunff, a book that perfectly aligns with my creative process. This cohort will be special‚Äîfueled by everything I‚Äôve learned through writing the book and my evolving perspective on visual thinking.

Links below to preorder the book and join Cohort 13. I hope to see you inside!

---

01:24 Announcing Cohort 13 of the Visual Thinking Workshop

06:54 The Hidden Risk of AI: Are You Giving Up Your Agency?

snippet.title: VLOG Episode 7: Self-Publishing from Scratch in 6 Weeks: 2 Advanced AI Strategies for Writers
snippet.description:
20% discount on the Summit: http://www.eventbrite.nl/e/869135988137/?discount=NewsDF
üßë‚Äçüíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm
‚úèÔ∏è Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/  üöÄ Cohort 13 starts on 12 April 2024. 
üìÖ Don't miss the EU PKM Summit https://pkmsummit.com/


----
I am attempting the impossible. I will try to write and self-publish a book about Visual Thinking in ~6 weeks, capture my process in a VLOG, and present my learnings at the EU PKM Summit on 14-15 March 2025

Here's episode 6 of my ü§Øcrazy project. This episode gives you a quick walkthrough of the different things on my mind regarding my book: editing, cover design, generating the epub, KDB and pre-orders, PKM Summit, and this VLOG. I got my hands full.

----

If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

üì© If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on üê¶ Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian

----

snippet.title: VLOG Episode 6 - Self-Publishing "Sketch Your Mind" in 6 Weeks
snippet.description:
20% discount on the Summit: http://www.eventbrite.nl/e/869135988137/?discount=NewsDF
üßë‚Äçüíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm
‚úèÔ∏è Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/  üöÄ Cohort 13 starts on 12 April 2024. 
üìÖ Don't miss the EU PKM Summit https://pkmsummit.com/


----
I am attempting the impossible. I will try to write and self-publish a book about Visual Thinking in ~6 weeks, capture my process in a VLOG, and present my learnings at the EU PKM Summit on 14-15 March 2025

Here's episode 6 of my ü§Øcrazy project. This episode gives you a quick walkthrough of the different things on my mind regarding my book: editing, cover design, generating the epub, KDB and pre-orders, PKM Summit, and this VLOG. I got my hands full.

----

If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

I am attempting the impossible. I will try to write and self-publish a book about Visual Thinking in ~6 weeks, capture my process in a VLOG, and present my learnings at the EU PKM Summit on 14-15 March 2025

Here's episode 5 of my ü§Øcrazy project. In this episode, I explain the Progressive Elaboration process, how I progressively define the opening and closing paragraph of parts, chapters and sections to achieve cohesive prose spanning across chapters in my book.

snippet.title: Creating an Outline and Authoring Chapters - Self-Publishing 4D PKM in 6 Weeks - VLOG Episode 4
snippet.description:
ü§î Help me on style, title and cover art. Please fill in this short survey https://forms.microsoft.com/r/FYdLFhUQrc
üßë‚Äçüíª Join the Techno-Visual PKM Community https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/tvpkm
‚úèÔ∏è Sign up for the Visual Thinking Workshop: https://www.visual-thinking-workshop.com/  üöÄ Cohort 13 starts on 12 April 2024. 
üìÖ Don't miss the EU PKM Summit https://pkmsummit.com/

----
I am attempting the impossible. I will try to write and self-publish a book about Visual Thinking in ~6 weeks, capture my process in a VLOG, and present my learnings at the EU PKM Summit on 14-15 March 2025

Here's episode 4 of my ü§Øcrazy project. In this episode, I take you through my workflow for crafting the outline of my book, and then writing chapters using Google Gemini 2.0, NotebookLM, and OpenAI ChatGPT.  You'll see how I leverage AI tools to brainstorm, refine ideas, and bring the book to life.
----

If you find  my videos helpful, please say thanks by buying me a coffee: https://ko-fi.com/zsolt

üì© If you want to connect, you can reach me: (@zsviczian) on the Obsidian Members Group (OMG) on Discord, or on üê¶ Twitter: https://twitter.com/zsviczian

----
